description:
A rainbow map for Day 1 points #30DayMapChallenge ! :D

The most sighted bird in Sydney & NSW is the Aussie Rainbow Lorikeet.

Sooo far behind but determined to do them all so I keep learning.
#30DayMapChallenge 
Day 2 lines theme. A quick boring one to catch up... public transport in Sydney. (After I spent days trying to get other data I really wanted).

Day 3 polygons #30DayMapChallenge I discovered some family history while looking at Sydney heritage data, so of course it went in :) (if it's of interest I can turn the labels on for everything; that was taking tooo long to get right).

Day 4 hexagons #30DayMapChallenge  
Not sure about this sightings data üòÇ ...23 in close vicinity to the wildlife zoo & maritime museum, but I love turtles üê¢

Day 5 raster #30dayMapChallenge Maybe pretty basic but I had to learn most of thisüòÆ Found 1m DEM, hillshade at 9am 5 November, over satellite. I spent a whole day trying to merge the DEM files, with me or QGIS failing & errors & losing resolution & projection failures. Still fun

Day 6 blue #30dayMapChallenge Apparently Australia has the most backyard pools of anywhere in the world. I looked at satellite images to see if I could extract blue pools but no idea, they're so small. So here's swimming for everyone & Sydney Harbour which isn't really blue.

Day 7 red #30dayMapChallenge ...playing around with symbols & styling in QGIS, & the increasing temperatures, matching the Bureau of Meteorology colour scale. I don't know what I did but had to stop else I'll never catch up üòÇ

Day 8 green #30dayMapChallenge National parks, local parks and for my friend, off leash dog parks. Took ages as mapped all the dog data myself from local council lists. Parks data; local OSM & national NPWS. Why is it so hard to find local parks spatial data.
Day 9 yellow #30dayMapChallenge Follow the sun ‚òÄÔ∏è Involved maths üò¨ and not at all sure it's correct, but fun to try & work out & then figure out how to plot it in QGIS.

Day 10 black & white #30dayMapChallenge Playing with symbols trying to get hachure kinda things in qgis. Not very good but catching up. Could have spent days in Illustrator tidying that up & making it look hand made :)
Day 11 elevation #30dayMapChallenge Made these contours from a DEM when I finally got a merged file working. Simple again but learning everything :)

Trying again to post a smaller gif file for Day 12 to twitter
#30dayMapChallenge

Day 13 tracks #30dayMapChallenge is a mess. I had grand plans of making a lovely walking tracks of Sydney map but omg the data. I had to give up else I'd be here until next November üòÇ (This is one I want to do properly when I've more time).
Day 14 boundaries #30dayMapChallenge How many do we really need? There's so many more, so chose one of each of the official categories I could think of.
Day 15 names #30dayMapChallenge playing with labels in QGIS :)

Day 20 rural #30dayMapChallenge Yeah skipped some days but still determined to do them all :) For now doing what I had ideas & could find data for.

Geo-referenced an 1894 map, hillshade, water to see the differences.
Day 28 funny #30dayMapChallenge Fun for Sydney NYE üòÇ made in QGIS.

Starting the #30DayMapChallenge. Don't have a ton of time today, but, for day one's challenge "points," I used my {ctar} package to get positions of all the trains in Chicago and plotted them according to color. #rstats #gis

For today's #30DayMapChallenge prompt "raster," I have maps of nighttime light data collected by NOAA satellites averaged over a year. These "light pollution" data are useful as a proxy for development or rurality and are just generally fun to play with.

If you don't want to read the blog My Day 01 - Points #30DayMapChallenge main map, LS (Leeds) Postcode as Points, Leeds City Region Boundary (Black) Leeds Travel to Work Boundary (Blue)...

#30DayMapChallenge Day 03 - Polygons;  #QGIS QGIS built Voronoi Polygons derived from GP (Doctors) Postcodes, with Number of Doctors per Polygon... in England. From @NHSDigital  & @OrdnanceSurvey #OpenData Don't think there's any #Open GP Boundary Data? so thought I'd make some.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 04 - Hexagons, what is the  distribution of Leeds 108K Street light?  Frequency of lights  mapped per 1km Hexagon, in #QGIS, showing hot spots and gaps in coverage (thought @StevieBYorks would like this for #SmartCities)

#30DayMapChallenge Here's my map Day 06 - Blue, bit of a play on 'The Thin Blue Line', Choropleth of Number of Police Officers per 1000 people in @qgis, based on Mid 2018 numbers. Uses @ONS @OrdnanceSurvey & @ukhomeoffice data - links in thread...

#30DayMapChallenge my Day 07 - Red, a little late!  Took far, far more prospecting, mining and grokking than I expected...  Blood Units Donated per 1000 population, a re-creation of a 2016 WHO report map.  Needs a bit more QC, 90% happy with it I think.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 08  - Green, another play on the colour: Pharmacy Densities in Leeds City Region:  Epanechnicov Kernel Density at 2km Radius, showing hot and cold spots, and areas with no pharmacies, built in @qgis using @openstreetmap and @OrdnanceSurvey data.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 09 - Yellow. Another first for me, thought I'd have a go at a classic in @qgis Leeds City Region by night, in three intuitively coloured layers; Roads and Buildings from @OrdnanceSurvey VectorMap District and Streetlights points from @DataGovUK

#30DayMapChallenge Day-10 Black and White.  Density Map of Zebra Crossings built in @qgis, frequency per 10km square, based on @openstreetmap data and using @OrdnanceSurvey boundaries.  Seems an unusual distribution... sorry another play on colours/words, not much time today!

Day 3: Polygons
Spent a week doing the @kennethfield election maps thing ‚Äì love it! Value by alpha, transparency is like a ‚Äústrength‚Äù of win by vote share. Red won.

Day 4: Hexagons
Same data as my Day 1 points, binned and normalized by population via Esri demographics. Outlined hex bins contained at least one mass murder.

Day 5: Raster
Landsat pseudocolor of sea ice breaking up around #BylotIsland #Nunavut with a tiny touch of hillshade. I was doing fieldwork on one of these glaciers on this date. The most incredible place I‚Äôve ever seen- and so few ever will. #30DayMapChallenge #WomenInGeospatial

Day 6: Blue
Started this map to enter @pinakographos monochrome competition, went off task and missed the deadline by several months. Fun fact, compasses don‚Äôt work on #BylotIsland due to its proximity to magnetic north! #30DayMapChallenge #PondInlet #Nunavut #WomenInGeospatial

Day 7: Red 
More monochrome! All 14443 GPS points are a semi-transparent bird footprint belonging to one of 28 individual birds. The Red-backed shrike is also a Red List bird meaning the population is in severe decline and globally threatened #30DayMapChallenge #WomenInGeospatial

Day 8: Green
Started this by trying to mimic @John_M_Nelson ‚Äòs Appalachian Trail map to replace an old West Coast Trail poster that I inherited with my office. I officially love monochrome. 
#30DayMapChallenge #WomenInGeospatial #ArcGISPro

Yellow fever is a vaccine preventable disease that also has a surprising gender disparity. Data from the WHO. 
Yellow monochrome is hard, this map gets filed under learning experience.

Whenever I experiment or start a map without a clear purpose there‚Äôs a good chance it will be of somewhere in the Canadian Arctic.

Here‚Äôs a look along the Rocky Mountain trench using only the @LivingAtlas global terrain layers in #ArcGISPro. It leaves me with questions about the placement of that provincial boundary.

Day 12: Movement
Crash course on animation in #ArcGISPro for me today! Been meaning to do that for some time now, yet another benefit of participating in the #30DayMapChallenge !

Day 13: Tracks
A small subset of yesterday‚Äôs data ‚Äìjust the northbound tracks of one bird named Leo. The colours are coded to match the dates across all 4 years. I am just amazed at how closely the paths match. I could play with data from @MovebankTeam all day #30DayMapChallenge

Apologies if I have made any offensive errors in this map. I chose an area of confusing boundaries and wound up more confused than expected. Will definitely need to revisit this down the road. #30DayMapChallenge

Hexagons like crazy üôÄ Now I'm a cool spatial data analyst, too. Here's a land use map of Helsinki, based on Corine Land Cover 2018 (class 2, majority in each hexagon). Data by: @SYKEinfo #30DayMapChallenge #helsinki #landuse #maank√§ytt√∂ #alueet #kaavoitus

Blue. We have this party called Sininen tulevaisuus (Blue Future) and here's how they did in the latest parliamentary elections. Data: @Tilastokeskus #30DayMapChallenge #vaalit #eduskuntavaalit #blue

Red. Alive beef visited Helsinki this week. Beef can also be slang. Beef is red and it is produced. Here's how it changed during 2014-2018. Data: @LukeFinland, @Tilastokeskus  #30DayMapChallenge #beef #maatalous #naudanliha #liha #nauta #el√§imyys

Green. Ireland is green so here's where Irish people live in Finland üçÄ Big surprises all around. I should totally make a book out of all these maps and force my friends to buy them and profit. Data: @Tilastokeskus #ireland #eire #population #30DayMapChallenge

Yellow. I used @mbostock's D3JS stuff to create the map, changed the world data, then "coded" a magic button to download pic as an svg, which wasn't really an svg, but had to be modified with a text editor, then it was an svg and I could edit it with @inkscape #30DayMapChallenge

Black and white. Back to Porsas, again a lidar-derived DSM, but visualised with @blender_org. Other tools used: @rstudio, @qgis Lidar data: @HelsinkiKymp #30DayMapChallenge #blackandwhite #b3d #dsm #helsinki #porsas #lidar

Elevation. I visited Urho Kekkonen National Park in 2013. And, because I was so crossfit, I climbed one of those fells, like a total beast #crossfit boss #bro! Rendered with #rayshader by @tylermorganwall, DEM by @Maanmittaus #30DayMapChallenge #dataviz #maps #dem @rstudio @qgis

A very quick look at HSL City Bike travel data. Only travels from a station to another station present (also, some stations were missing?), routes with less than 100 travels not on the map. Data: @HSL_HRT @HSLdevcom #avoindata #opendata #py√∂r√§ily #helsinki #30DayMapChallenge

Tracks! Animals leave tracks, except puffins, who are too smart. So they have to be outsmarted. This puffin seems to have been all over the place (or perhaps it fooled us all ü§î) Data from:  @MovebankTeam / Aevar Petersen #naturalearth #30DayMapChallenge #puffin

Boundaries, not all of them so simple. Disputed areas according to Natural Earth data (v 4.1.0). Most of the work here done with Inkscape, because QGIS was crashing a lot, due to the draw effects I think. #30DayMapChallenge #naturalearth @qgis @inkscape

Names. I ran a sentiment analysis on @helsinki street names (or street address name points) using the demo tools of #Kielipankki. As we all know, the machine never lies. Such cheerful results. Data: @HelsinkiKymp #30DayMapChallenge #helsinki #nimist√∂ #dataviz #maps

Places. Buildings are places! I've worked in all of these. LOD2 level 3D buldings, rendering with Blender/Cycles (sky texture didn't work in Eevee üòî). Data: @helsinki @Helsinki3D #30DayMapChallenge #b3d #blender #buildings #helsinki
Zones. I wanted to do danger zone and @kennyloggins and whatnot, but ended up with this classic instead. #k√∂ppengeiger #climate #30DayMapChallenge
Globe. Rumor has it that spatial data is everywhere. Like, all around the globe üò± Rendered with Eevee/Blender, thanks @Olaviuss for the tutorial! #30DayMapChallenge #earth #globe #blender #b3d

Urban. Percentage of livable floor area of total floor area in downtown Helsinki. Darker color = bigger percentage, bigger circle = more total floor area. Data: @hsy_fi, @HelsinkiKymp #30DayMapChallenge #urban #living #asuminen #helsinki #rakennustietoruudukko #bubbles

Rural. 20 maps down, 10 to go! Here's a study of the amount of tractors / 100 ha of arable land in Finland. So much disruption. Data: @LukeFinland, @Tilastokeskus, @TraficomFinland #30DayMapChallenge #rural #maatalous #agriculture #disruption #disruptio

Environment! Finnish _Environment_ Institute is in Viikki and here's a motion-blurry glimpse of its _environnement_. Data: @Helsinki3D / @helsinki #30DayMapChallenge #blender #b3d #viikki #syke #opensource #opendata
Built environment. Humans and beavers build dams sometimes. This is a dam in Imatra, visualised as a coloured point cloud. Data: @Maanmittaus #30DayMapChallenge #pato #dam #imatra #vuoksi #lidar
Population. Revisiting one of old research themes from my urban research days: single households in Helsinki. #30DayMapChallenge #aluesarjat #yksinasuminen #helsinki #asuminen #v√§est√∂ #population

Statistics. There's this stupid food gate in Finland. It's about whether or not it's OK to call something "vegetable meat". So here's a quick look at the evil municipalities, where fruit and veggies are processed and preserved. Data: @Tilastokeskus #30DayMapChallenge #kasvisliha

Climate. Playing around with FMI open data. Monthly precipitation on selected sites in Finland (2018). Never really used the histogram chart option in QGIS before. Data: @meteorologit, @Tilastokeskus  #30DayMapChallenge #climate #precipitation

Hydrology. Not sure if beavers move rivers, humans sometimes do. Like in Koskenkyl√§, PERNAJA (üí™), Finland. I remember this being mentioned in one of my old geography textbooks. Data: @Maanmittaus #30DayMapChallenge #pernaja #koskenkyl√§ #forsby

Resources. Natural resources. (See? I did the 'Name is Bond. James Rodr√≠guez'-thing!). I wanted to do a cobalt map, but I chose to sleep instead. #30DayMapChallenge #ore #rock #metal #blackmetal #naturalresources #exports

Funny. My previous maps have been dead-serious. Time to loosen up and do something funny, and by funny I mean stupid. Fortunately, this map won't translate to English. Suomalaisten suosikkimatkakohde eli Thaimaase. #30DayMapChallenge #thaimaase #suomi #matkailu #kieli #kotus

My #30DayMapChallenge no. 01 -- points. Address points in Auckland New Zealand coloured by street number (colours probably need more tweaking). Code is here: https://t.co/xjHBD67Blp. Inspired by https://t.co/z9jgRKXIZv.
My #30DayMapChallenge no. 2 - contour lines of Mount Taranaki. Code: https://t.co/bQpRON2eOY
My #30DayMapChallenge no. 3 - downtown Auckland buildings. Code: https://t.co/32CeM4dNnf

My #30DayMapChallenge no. 4 - hexbinned tree points in the NZ 1:50k topographic data. I don‚Äôt know how well this shows actual tree coverage. And I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to put the zero (white) category in the legend üòî. Code: https://t.co/oxVJrnsTHV

My #30DayMapChallenge no. 5 - the NIWA bathymetry model. My first time working with raster data. @fogonwater made a wayyyy better visualisation of this data in We Are Here üôÇ. Code: https://t.co/kUnJOcF0QY

My #30DayMapChallenge no. 6 - the nine largest lakes of New Zealand. You wouldn‚Äôt know it from looking at the code but this took me two hours to make. (So much for my self-imposed 30 minute limit üòÖ). https://t.co/xKttV9kKe4

My #30DayMapChallenge no. 7 - population change in Auckland region 2018 Census vs 2013. One dot per additional person. A few areas had small population reductions that are not shown. Code: https://t.co/Xn2gaSuv1w
My #30DayMapChallenge no. 8 (green) - New Zealand grassed land. Code: https://t.co/sdsG0Juggz (warning: Big Data!).
Day 9 of #30DayMapChallenge - yellow: Lighthouses. Code: https://t.co/CgDPm8YPV7
Day 10 of #30DayMapChallenge - black and white: New Zealand airports (ordered from north to south). Code: https://t.co/6CC8Kl5SGj

Day 11 of #30DayMapChallenge - elevation: Parts of New Zealand above certain elevations. I wanted to make this from the national DEM but the data is 18GBüò¨, so I used contours instead. Code: https://t.co/iZMcimWUGe

Day 12 of #30DayMapChallenge - movement. An example of how fiddly it can be to make "simple" maps. This shows net migration to New Zealand between 2010 and 2019 but it's not complete. Read on for the tale of data wrangling and woe. Code: https://t.co/7Gj61dbtl3

Day 13 of #30DayMapChallenge - tracks. Building on @zentree's map from yesterday, storm tracks in the South Pacific, coloured by wind speed. Code: https://t.co/D3sksCwnWG. Some technical details below.
Day 14 of #30DayMapChallenge - boundaries: Auckland's Rural Urban Boundary. Outside the RUB, urban development is generally not permitted. Code: https://t.co/DT3xtigyGP

Day 15 of #30DayMapChallenge - names: Regions of New Zealand named by the name that is most similar to all other geographic names in the same region (excluding streams. there are so many streams!). Just a silly experiment üôÉ Code: https://t.co/GzyMxKEhxJ
Day 16 of #30DayMapChallenge - places: The places that you can and cannot (theoretically) post a letter to in New Zealand. Code (bad, horrible, inefficient code): https://t.co/oMZDnTn8ZB

Day 17 of #30DayMapChallenge - zones: All the zones, overlays, precincts etc defined in Auckland's Unitary Plan (urban planning rules). Each layer is black with 10% opacity, so darker areas have more planning rules. Code: https://t.co/grzlRKDBIo

Day 18 of #30DayMapChallenge - globe: What I wanted to do didn't work out, so here's a consolation visualisation of the night/dawn/day/dusk/night times during 2019 at different locations in New Zealand. Code: https://t.co/pNHvrnLn2O #notreallyamap
Day 19 of #30DayMapChallenge - urban: Change in Auckland population density, 2018 census vs 2006. Code: https://t.co/IYGGU7kAv1
Just a simple one for day 20 of #30DayMapChallenge - rural: The parts of Auckland with some kind of rural zoning. Code: https://t.co/8TpA6WTRIO
Day 21 of #30DayMapChallenge - environment: New Zealand's four largest river networks (largest in the sense of having the most branches), including associated lakes. Code: https://t.co/g1yqXhkBn2

#30DayMapChallenge , nr. 8, "green"is het thema. Jaren geleden al maakte ik een kaart van openheid en overbouwing in het Nederlands UNESCO-Werelderfgoed, de Beemster is er √©√©n van.

#30DayMapChallenge nr. 9, "yellow".... ik dacht al aan bananen of aan het land waar Jumbo-Visma na 3 weken koers de leiderstrui wil bezitten (voor de heel makkelijke oplossing), wat zoekwerk leverde een dataset over verwachte landbouwopbrengsten op. Zoals zonnebloemen.
#30DayMapChallenge nr. 10, zwart-wit..... er was al in 2017 een passend onderwerp voor. En in Rhenen is er sinds die tijd nog geen uitbreiding geweest.

#30DayMapChallenge nr. 11, "Elevation". Hiervoor iets uit een gelukkig uitgebreid archief, Arnhem telt verschillende beschermde gezichten (meer hierover op https://t.co/2LKl1GXdfX) waar hoogteverschillen medebepalend zijn voor het karakter. Zoals in Geitenkamp:

#30DayMapChallenge nr 12 "Movement" levert toch weer een actuele kaart op, als de plannen van vandaag doorgaan. Wat is je snelwegpanorama, binnenkort, op personenvervoer dat die 130km/u in die 1km-zone langs autosnelwegen meestal wel mag (en kan) halen?

#30DayMapChallenge 13, "Tracks" en ik was mijn spoor volledig kwijt op weg naar post 13 bij het WMOC2015 in/rond G√∂teborg. Na bijna een half uur het zoeken opgegeven om nog op een redelijke tijd af te reizen naar Denemarken.
#30DayMapChallenge nr 14, "borders". Het geoportaal van Provincie Overijssel biedt een mooi bestand van historische gemeentegrenzen, hoe ziet dat eruit voor een willekeurige gemeente daar?
#30DayMapChallenge nr 15. Namen als thema, daar kun je de provincies mee vullen.
#30DayMapChallenge nr 16, "Places" en er zijn nogal wat vertalingen van. Welke woonplaatsen bevat de "jongste" gemeente van de provincie Utrecht, volgens de BAG?

#30DayMapChallenge nr. 17, "Zones". Met strippenkaarten leerde je het vanzelf, hoeveel zones je busreis zou bevatten. Niet dat het volgens CC-PDM 1.0 hoeft, maar provincies Gelderland en Overijssel verdienen wel een vermelding als leverancier van de brondata voor deze kaart.

#30DayMapChallenge nr. 18, "Globe". Voor ik verder aan het experimenteren ga, eerst een terugblik op de activiteiten van het GCE-programma in het najaar van 2017. Nog niet echt een globe, maar wel wereldwijde activiteit binnen en buiten de partnerlanden.

#30DayMapChallenge nr. 19 ("Urban") met wat vertraging. Hoe zit het met stedelijke dynamiek in beschermde gezichten en wederopbouwgebieden (uitsnedes Nijmegen en Westerhoutkwartier? Met gegevens van BAG-panden gemaakt en besproken met o.a.@_Peter_Timmer en @blomwederopbouw

#30DayMapChallenge Water stress measures if avaliable water can meet local needs. I Used data from the World Resources Institute (Aqueduct) to map water stress projections in the future. 

Climate change + population growth are together pushing many Asian watersheds to the edge.

#30DayMapChallenge #Suriname has one of the worlds largest reservoirs. Local Maroons, descended from escaped slaves, work today with the government and NGOs to steward nearby forests. Many trees weren't cut when the lake was filled, and so are still standing on the bottom today.

#30DayMapChallenge Uzbekistan is one of the worlds leading cotton producers, but the massive amount of water required for its cotton fields have helped drain the Aral sea, shrinking it into a tiny portion of its pre-modern boundaries.

#30DayMapChallenge  - Day 12: Movement - Found amazing dataset on animal tracking data on https://t.co/ONNONt7Au8, Visualized movement of 10 bald eagles observed in BC in last 12 months or so.    #rstats  Trying to figure out how to use leaflet package.

#30DayMapChallenge 

Locations in Great Britain where names consist entirely of vowels or entirely of consonants  - well done Wales ;-)

#30DayMapChallenge Day 2 - Lines

A map of my locality with only the linestrings rendered
So for day 3 of #30DayMapChallenge the theme was polygons. I decided to make something pretty. Here is London rendered in green spaces and buildings only. I think it's quite pretty.
Day 4 of #30DayMapChallenge -hexagons. Bees make hexagons, so let's map bee plant diversity in Cornwall and pick the best place for bees to feed.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 5 - Rasters. Whoops! I misheard that as Rastas. So where will we find them?   

Tell me the name of this colourful Island (in many senses) rendered from Natural Earth with a gradient on the R value.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 6 - Blue

I resisted the temptation to play with water and looked at the boy band "Blue" instead. Here is every concert they ever played, geocoded  and linked in order on a nice blue globe. If I'd had more time I'd have animated it.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 7 - Red.

I found all of the "Red" places in Great Britain and linked them up with the Travelling Salesman algorithm. Before you complain..only places with a distinct "Red" allowed.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 8 - Green. 

Here we have every country in the world with the colour green appearing on its flag. Note the density in Africa. Let's see if I have missed any!

Full image at:  https://t.co/qBe9NQhCmq

#30DayMapChallenge Day 9 - Yellow.

Here we have the Chinese "Yellow" mountains, or Huangshan as they call them natively. I've  exaggerated their height a bit and added a nice yellow tint. Hope this helps with the Saturday hangover ;-)

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10 - Black and White.

Black and white made me think of old films. I scraped every British black and white film title from Wikipedia and turned them into a geowordcloud. [please note, NO inset box for the Orkneys ;-)]

#30DayMapChallenge Day 11 - Elevation.

Here we have Snowdon or Yr Wyddfa to give it its proper name. Visualised in elevation numbers wrapped to contours with height dictating font size and opacity. [link to original https://t.co/9Fk4NYeNr4]

#30DayMapChallenge Day 12 -Movement. I am returning to my home town for this one. I wondered what would be the shortest route to ride my bike on every road in Brixham. One Chinese postman later and we have this animation. Big thanks to @underdarkGIS for Time Manager in #QGIS

#30DayMapChallenge Day 13 - Tracks.

What's the longest track you've ever ridden? Mine was 2731 miles racing the Tour Divide from Canada to Mexico earlier this year. Here's the route overview and elevation profile. Also, my story : https://t.co/f7mTYURr7f

#30DayMapChallenge Day 14 - Boundaries.

Boris wins the election, his mate Donald tells him that he needs to build WALLS! So Boris orders every county to get on with it. Who has to build the longest wall??

[Link to full image: https://t.co/YJ9khcwxyR]

#30DayMapChallenge Day 15 - Names.

I took the @OrdnanceSurvey Opennames dataset and found all towns and cities. I then "twinned" them with their British namesakes. Finally I made a network map connecting those places that share the same name.

https://t.co/t5XI2SjE89

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16 Places.

Damn I misheard that as PLAICE Sand made a map of the density of plaice catches from ICES open data ...(OK I'll get my coat)

#30DayMapChallenge Day 17 - Zones

Imagine you went back to the 70's, ingested a large amount of LSD and then tried to figure out where the underground zones of London layer geographically. Well, no need, as I have done it for you.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 18 Globe.

If I ruled the world? Maybe I'd try and reshape it in my image? So for today's challenge I took an image of myself, polygonised it and slapped into onto a globe. Hmmm not very recognisable

#30DayMapChallenge Day 20 - Urban

I imagined the urban areas as the organs of an industrialised country connected by arterial trunk roads as veins. This is the closest I was able to get with my limited styling skills. Gunther von Hagens eat your heart out

#30daymapchallenge Day 19 (phew!) Urban

I've tried to illustrate the urban decay of England and Wales by punching out the areas classified as urban and colouring the remainder with darker green being more rural

#30DayMapChallenge Day 21- environment

Sites of specific scientific interest. I focused on the Lake District and mapped SSSIs with average daily traffic flow next to them. I was shocked at the numbers.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 22 - Built Environment

Today's map is a joint effort with my son who is building an immersive game situated in the real built environment @xmpli. This video shows a fly through of a virtual Brixham built upon Ordnance Survey data

#30DayMapChallenge Day 23 - Population

I took the population of England and Wales at a household level and found the nearest pub for each person. This shows the busiest pub per county with the queue outside visualised as a line (1 metre per person). Table shows top 10.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 24 - Statistics

They say there are lies, damned lies and statistics. So how about some statistics about dams. 43% of countries don't have any dams and for those that do there is an average of 135926 people per dam

#30DayMapChallenge Day 25 - Climate

CO2 emissions are driving climate change. A car emits on average 4.6 metric tonnes per year. This map renders GB as total emissions per postcode district annually based on car ownership. The numbers scare the life out of me.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 26

FME is still trying to render the idea I had so let's save that for another day! Here's our canal network and the urban areas it links up

#30DayMapChallenge Day 27 - Resources

When I hear resources it reminds me of mines. For all you Poldark fans did you realise just how many tin mines there were in Cornwall? I believe the working tin mine count is now zero.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 28 - Funny

What do you get when you create a route linking all of the UK prisons?

A CONtour map!
#30DayMapChallenge Day 29 - Experimental. It had to be one of the biggest experiments so here is the large Hadron collider rendered above ground
#30DayMapChallenge Day 30 - Home.  A hand drawn map of my street from memory. Phew we are done!

Thanks to @tjukanov, got my hands on #MapboxGLJS for the first time for #30DayMapChallenge day 4: hexagons. I was also inspired by @puddingviz's project.

My first maps of the #30DayMapChallenge! The prompt was "Points" - here are all schools in the Auckland and Wellington areas by the ethnicity of their students and the size of the school.¬†#rstats #rspatial

Day 2 of the #30DayMapChallenge: Lines. Earthquakes are the biggest natural peril risk in NZ, and I often wonder how a big EQ would affect infrastructure, electricity etc. I plotted the major faultlines and powerlines, along with the biggest EQs we've seen in the past yr.

Day 3 of the #30DayMapChallenge is brought to you by a pet spatial peeve of mine: Postcodes! 
A lot of companies love using postcodes, but they don't fit neatly within any other geometries & often mean I have to do a bunch of other calculations to get things assigned properly.

A belated Day 4 of the #30DayMapChallenge, looking at how people who live in the Auckland CBD get to work. I walk to work and find it really interesting (and disappointing) how dependent Auckland is on cars.

I'm STILL working on Day 4 of the #30DayMapChallenge (it turns out hexagons are quite tricky, or I'm managing to make them quite tricky), so for Day 5, here is one of my favourite raster images that I've made. I was experimenting with detecting rivers using sentinel data

Day 6 of the #30DayMapChallenge, with the theme Blue. This map shows changes to the Burrendong Dam in NSW, Australia over the past 2 years.  I do quite a bit of work on climate change in Australia, and here you can really see the drought in action.

For Day 7 of the #30DayMapChallenge the theme was Red. I looked at the incidents called in to fire stations around NZ during the week of Guy Fawke's üî•This involved scraping the website, cleaning the data and doing a fuzzy merge w a geocoded list of firestations #rstats #rspatial

Day 8 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Green, and possibly one of my favourite maps (visually) so far. I've mapped the duration of property ownership for each parcel in in Nelson, NZ. #rspatial #stats

Day 9 of the #30DayMapChallenge (a day late...) with the theme Yellow. I looked at the number of dairy cattle over time in NZ and was surprised to find that this has grown by  500% in some regions since 1994 ü§ØüêÆ

Day 10 of the #30DayMapChallenge: Black & white. One thing I really want to do at some point is identify individual trees from LiDAR DSMs
Q: How could I quantify & identify the "fluffy" nature of trees in the raster? (As opposed to buildings, which have very defined outlines)
Day 11 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Elevation. Today I mapped the elevation of a sample of 1 million dwellings across New Zealand ‚õ∞Ô∏èüìè#rstats #spatial

Day 12 of the #30DayMapChallenge: Movement! I dug into some data on what cats get up to. 
Here we've got the most & least active cat in NZ, with Blue Nelson coming out on top by covering almost 4 km per dayüòº & Tasha sticking to the couch at 42 metres per day üò∏ #rspatial #rstats

Day 13 of the #30DayMapChallenge w the theme Tracks. I had fun with the cats yesterday, so here are the most & least social cats in NZ. Cats are pretty anti-social - none crossed paths w more than 3 other cats - but Monty II did have some friends. There are also a lot of loners!

Day 14 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Boundaries. I mapped the proportion of home ownership in Auckland by meshblock (meshblock boundary - okay, the link is a bit weak üòÜ) You can see an abrupt shift from Kohimarama to Glen Innes & high lvls of ownership in Titirangi

Halfway through the #30DayMapChallenge! Today the theme was Names, and I plotted the locations of the top 5 most common street names in New Zealand. At #1 is "Park". Are these names what you would have expected? #rstats #rspatial

Day 16 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Places. I categorized historic places in NZ and mapped them. (Note that those labelled NA or not in any of these categories have been removed). Still not sure what a Battery is to be honest but apparently we have quite a few ü§∑

Day 17 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Zones! I looked at houses in the Christchurch redzone, which is the exclusion zone from the major 2011 earthquakes. If you look at aerial imagery now, you can see that these areas are now covered in grass as buildings are removed

Day 18 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Globe üåè. I looked at unemployment rates and found massive variation in Africa, with Niger sitting at 0.25% & South Africa at 27%. 
Would you have guessed that South Africa has the highest rates globally? (I probably wouldn't have)

Day 19 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Urban. I was thinking about what defines an urban area, and how far it is from the closest H&M may have crossed my mind... üòÇso here we have a comparison of the usual meshblock definitions & my new H&M based metric #rstats #rspatial

Day 21 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Environment. I looked at the maximum wind & rain across NZ over the past 40 years from reanalysis data. 
Reanalysis data is not an observation - it's a way of getting data for all points & time periods using observations and a model

Day 22 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Built Environment. I compared how much was being spent on building new houses in 2019 compared to 1999 üè†. 
The biggest growth was in the Mackenzie District, which jumped from 1.6m to 21m. I didn't expect that! #rspatial

Day 24 of the #30DayMapChallenge w the theme Statistics. I looked at the % of dwellings that are less than 100m from the coast.
NZ is very preoccupied by earthquakes, but I actually think coastal erosion is more of a problem in some ways, especially when it comes to insurance

Day 25 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Climate! I made my first animated map using the maximum monthly temperatures in Australia over the past year and a half. Australia has seen the extreme effects of climate change first hand, with extremely high temperatures and drought. #rspatial

Day 26 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Hydrology! I mapped pipes in Auckland by the pipe diameter. üöøüö∞
This map was made in QGIS rather than R (my usual) and I've also never used this data source before.
Day 28 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Funny! I decided to find the most common dog breeds in New Zealand, and the names that those breeds are most likely to have #rstats #rspatial

Day 29 of the #30DayMapChallenge with the theme Experimental! I took this as permission to improve one of my previous maps üòÜ Here we've got the max summer temperature in Australia, going back to 1910. 
We can also see new weather stations being added over time #rspatial #rstats

Day 30 of the #30DayMapChallenge - holy shit you guys I did it! The last theme is Home, and here a snapshot of every place I've lived in New Zealand. 
I was a couple of weeks old when we moved to NZ, and we lived on Mt Ruapehu (2nd from the top) until the eruption in 1995/1996

It's the 4th of November which means the day of Hexagons in the #30DayMapChallenge! We just uploaded this map to Location Insights Explorer, showing the location of animal rescue incidents attended by the London Fire Brigade. It's pink! Have a look: https://t.co/4i9xVxLZyk

Today is day 8 of #30DayMapChallenge and the theme is "green". Here we have visualised the number of watt-hours of energy generated from renewable (greenüíö) resources in each Local Authority. You can slide through to see how this varies from year to year!
Our black & white map for Sunday's theme of #30DayMapChallenge looks stunning, don't you think? Have a look here: https://t.co/BEfbVDajfZ

For day 1 of the #30DayMapChallenge, "Points", I made a star map showing our 100 light-year radius neighborhood, highlighting the location of some possibly habitable planets. 3d space has been flattened to the plane of the Milky Way, while preserving distances from the Sun.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 4: Hexagons
@mapmakerdavid @SouthArrowMaps I spent way too long making a pretty metallic heading

#30DayMapChallenge Day 5: Raster
inverted dem using CleanTopo2, @pinakographos blender tutorial and a whole lot of open source software

#30DayMapChallenge Day 6: Blue
created in #QGIS using the @LINZLDS depth area layer with some shapeburst fill, raster image fill and some paper texture over the top for a water colour effect

#30DayMapChallenge Day 7: Red
I wanted to try and turn the cleantopo2 into Mars, found @Cchurchili amazing map layouts and could help but be inspired

#30DayMapChallenge Day 8: Green
The Tongariro Crossing and Emerald Lakes, the Emerald Lakes are actually some small ones but the lakes on Tongariro all have the vivid green colour. Made with #QGIS and inkscape and the beautiful topo data from my team at LINZ

#30DayMapChallenge Day 9: Yellow
Some yellow at least. Rural roads are number based on distance along the road leading to 85,696 the largest address. Inspired by @SchalkValentin layout from day 7 and turns out it was the colours on yet another map of yours I had saved @Cchurchili

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10: Black & White
Wanted to play around with the 3D viewer in #QGIS

#30DayMapChallenge Day 11: Elevation
Really liked the style posted by @cartocalypse but wanted to add in some text which was done in inkscape. Also had issues exporting so I turned it into a script. The Tararuas are a mountain range outside of Wellington

https://t.co/4UvSJsci00

#30DayMapChallenge Day 12: Movement
an ode to @dinopoloclub a wellington game studio full of incredibly nice people and their fun metro style game. The lines are base don wellington train lines. Made with open source. The game itself has lots of movement...

#30DayMapChallenge Day 13: Tracks
A track near where I live using a combination of @LINZLDS topo data and @greaterwgtn walking tracks. Finally got to use @drewfore tutorial to add some nice hachures to a finished map :) made with #QGIS and Inkscape

#30DayMapChallenge Day 14: Boundaries
There are no boundaries on this map as it is my subtle reminder of how great it would be if there was an actual official NZ localities dataset. Maybe one day... Mostly blender GDAL and GIMP

#30DayMapChallenge Day 15: Lego, oops I mean names. I tried to be clever and use a geometry generator in #QGIS for the name but ended up having to switch to Inkscape. Uses the new(ish) river names dataset from LINZ

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16: Places
Thought I would have another go at my place names map from points, I could easily spend a week tweaking it to be honest :)

#30DayMapChallenge Day 17: Zones
NZ Protected areas, mostly department of conservation land, I've removed the marine areas. Coworkers idea, data from LINZ. Little blender, lots of QGIS and GIMP

#30DayMapChallenge Day 28: Fun
Originally did this for a workmate who was heading over to oz, I think it should become an official map series

#30DayMapChallenge Day 29: Experimental
played with the lego style but fixed my draw order in #QGIS so it looks like the higher blocks are stacked. Also learn not to use map units with the drop shadow as it slowed the rendering down, but mm was very quick.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 30: Home
The 30day challenge has been a blast, I really enjoyed pushing myself and learning, but mostly being inspired by all the amazing maps and ideas people have shared. Thanks everyone

Day 1 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #points

Non residential buildings in #Edinburgh from #GeomniUK Edition 7 of UKBuildings database.

Non residential includes retail, industry, educational, offices, public buildings, health, religious, military and commercial.

Day 2 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #lines

Flight lines over #Paris from 2018 #survey 

The spacing represents how the #project had to be broken up into individual sections to work around the restrictions on altitude to ensure a constant resolution.

Day 3 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #polygons

UKBuildings polygons of #Newcastle and #Sunderland areas coloured by building height. Darker the red the higher the #building.

Day 5 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #raster

Detailed 2m resolution land-use data of #Nottingham used by Network providers to plan 5G coverage.
Different colours represent different classifications of land and densities of buildings and building use.

Day 6 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #blue

The surface water network and lakes around #Birmingham displayed on #OpenStreetMap background.

#map #mapping

Day 7 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #red

Geomni flew Greater London in summer of 2016 using a sensor that produced both standard colour imagery and infra-red imagery. This data has been used by @LDN_gov to derive a #London Tree Cover #map.

Day 9 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Yellow

Yellow is the colour of the airside markings at @STN_Airport that we mapped out using a high-resolution imagery database. The database was used by Stansted for maintenance and the markings themselves are used for navigation of aircraft.

Day 10 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #BlackAndWhite

Delving into the archives we found some immediate post-war, high resolution imagery by RAF showing bomb stricken areas just east of Kings Cross, London. Most of the ‚Äòhits‚Äô shown in the image are on Collier Street.

Day 11 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #elevation

Digital Surface Model of La Louvre, #Paris.

Created from high resolution stereo #imagery of Paris flown in 2018.

Day 12 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Movement
 
When flying to create our detailed aerial #imagery of #London in 2016 we managed to capture a birds eye view image of a¬†@British_Airways¬†aircraft mid-flight üò≤

Day 13 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Tracks

If you have ever wondered how detailed aerial photography is captured then this entry may help. 

The track of the aeroplane represents each ‚Äúclick‚Äù of the camera on just one of hundreds of tracks that were taken over Paris in 2018.

Day 14 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #boundaries

Image from #London 2016 of Lords Cricket Ground.

Can you see the ‚Äúboundary‚Äù?

Day 15 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #names 

Pubs called #George from UKMap data over UKMap Edition 23 (September 2019).

UKMap is a large-scale mapping database of the Greater London area. It contains many attributes which allows for the extraction and querying of features.

Day 16 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Places 

Did you know that over 23,000 buildings in London are situated on roads where 'PLACE' appears in the street name? A selection of these, from Central London, have been highlighted in Yellow.

Can you name any of these streets? üëÄ

Day 17 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Zones

A map showing #building #density zones in Sheffield

Orange = High Density = Urban zones
Blue = Low Density = Suburban zones

In our #UKLand product, areas are classified by density of buildings within them.

Day 18 of the #30DayMapChallenge -  #globe

2 images of #London showing Shakespeare‚Äôs Globe

1994 (Under Construction)
2013 (How it looks today)

Day 19 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #urban

Created from high res clutter,UKLand, utilises UKBuildings and UKLand to create parcels of land classified by their land use.

This map illustrates all the land parcels classified as a type of ‚ÄúUrban‚Äù class for the city of #Sheffield.

Day 20 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #rural

The red pixels, extracted from our national clutter 20m raster dataset, represent Agricultural Buildings in the Belfast area. 

The dataset was created to support the telecoms market to help with the distribution of 5G phone coverage

Day 21 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Environment

London has recently become a #NationalPark and these land-use and volume of built environment maps show the significant extent of the green environment in Greater London. 

@LondonNPC 

(1/2)

Day 22 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Built Environment

Can you name this town and building?üëÄ

This image was taken on 19 September 2019 using a Midas camera that captures high resolution vertical and oblique imagery

Detailed measurements and data can be derived from such imagery

Day 23 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Population

This map shows the density of residential dwellings in each of the London Boroughs. 

The lighter the shade, the less densely populated.

White = less than 2000 dwellings
Dark blue = more than 12,000 dwellings

Day 24 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Statistics

This map shows the land use types in the London Borough of Bexley and makes comparisons between this and the rest of Greater London. 

The proportion of top 5 land use types in Bexley are almost an exact match with Greater London!

Day 25 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Climate

The Thames Barrier prevents the floodplain of most of Greater London from being flooded by exceptionally high tides and storm surges.

Will the barrier be used more frequently due to the effects of climate change?

Day 26 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Hydrology

The Shape of (London's) Water

This map shows 'Surface Water' across Greater London. It was created using data extracted from UKMap. Surface water includes rivers, canals, lakes, ponds and swimming pools.

Day 27 of the #30DayMapChallenge - #Resources

This map, of Greater London and its surrounding areas, marks out the locations of a resource that almost every UK citizen will need to call upon at some point in their lives...The Emergency Services.

Day 28 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Funny

If you're looking for a good laugh then where better to head to than a Comedy Club? 

This map shows the locations of Comedy Clubs across Central London and it suggests that Leicester Square is the funniest place in the capital!

Day 29 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Experimental 

Here at Geomni we have begun experimenting with automatic extraction of roof details from our aerial imagery using AI and machine learning techniques. 

The process can provide us with information such as roof height and pitch.

Day 30 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Homes 

Last but not least, a map showing Victorian homes in three of the UK's major cities - London, Liverpool and Cardiff. 

The maps give a good indication of the expansion from Early Victorian (dark red) to Late Victorian (orange).

Starting the #30DayMapChallenge a bit late. My polygon map compares the geographical areas of the 3 different UK 2011 census output area boundaries in Central London!

The census boundaries can acquired here: https://t.co/BtI8FuoRKB

Day 4 of the #30DayMapChallenge and I made a Crop Map of England (CROME).  The vector dataset contains approximately 32 million hexagonal cells classifying England into over 20 crop types. Took a while to process and display the data at a national level!

#GIS #ArcGIS #Hexagons

Day 5 of the #30DayMapChallenge and I made a land cover map of London using the CEH's LCM 2015 raster dataset. I also calculated the total area of each land cover in the city.

#London #Raster #GIS

Day 6 of the #30DayMapChallenge. I made a river map of England using #Python and @geopandas. Darker blue indicates longer river stretches and lighter blue indicates shorter river stretches as mapped by the #WFD. Not bad for a first attempt at using python to visualise GIS data!

Day 7 of the #30DayMapChallenge. For today's red theme, I mapped the points of all recorded fire incidents from @LondonFire between January 2009 to December 2012. Second time using geopandas to make a map and I can now work with two vector layers in python!
Day 8 of the #30DayMapChallenge and today it's an @OrdnanceSurvey Greenspaces map of the UK. Simple and effective use of colours in #ArcGIS can produce some really beautiful maps.

Day 10 of the #30DayMapChallenge and I made a comparison map between a 1846 black and white map of Leeds and a 2019 colour map of Leeds. No university and no Hyde Park. A much smaller city with a lot more fields and open spaces than today!

Day 11 of the #30DayMapChallenge and I made an elevation map of a river catchment in the UK. Used a 5m DEM and hillshade layer to produce this map. Includes some zoomed in areas of the catchment. Can anyone name this river catchment which is from the North West of England?

Day 26 of the #30DayMapChallenge and I created a LiDAR-derived relative elevation model (REM). LiDAR data can be extremely useful to visualise river features such as historic river channels and floodplains!

More information about REMs can be found here: https://t.co/X7amX7Wycd

Day 5 of #30DayMapChallenge. I have to confess: I've never done a raster map before üôà so this is a bit unfinished. This map of Denmark is showing tree density data from CORINE downloaded it from kortforsyningen. The CORINE tree density value is % of coverage accdg to their site.

2.5D #floodrisk map of #Tharandt #Germany. All data (#elevation #DEM, #3D buildings, flood zones, aerial photographs) from #opendata portal #Sachsen. https://t.co/tVtGpjpSEQ. Day 11 #30DayMapChallenge #QGIS #Qgis2threejs plugin.

Day 17 of #30DayMapChallenge: zones. #Thiessen polygons (aka #Voronoi cells) for spatial #interpolation of temperatures in the Netherlands. Clear gradient from the North Sea coast to the inland in this season (early autumn).

#30DayMapChallenge Day 11 #elevation. False colour near infrared aerial photograph of downtown #Rotterdam draped over 0.5 m #LIDAR DSM (AHN3). #opendata #WCS and #WMTS through @PDOK_online plugin in #QGIS and visualisation with QGIS 3D view. The red colours indicate urban green.

Day 24 of #30DayMapChallenge: #statistics. On day 17 I posted a temperature map interpolated with #Thiessen polygons. We can interpolate the same data also using inverse distance weighting (IDW). Which one is better? https://t.co/RGBeeOaiC6

#30DayMapChallenge Day 26: #hydrology. Flow direction map created using #QGIS 3.10. #Crayfish plugin by @lutraconsulting used to visualise the #SAGA flow direction output with arrows. #opendata: #SRTM 1 Arc Second DEM blended with hillshade. Streams derived using #Strahler order.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 27: Resources. Inden open pit #lignite mine in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. The profile shows how the Wang & Liu fill sinks algorithm fills up the pit. #opendata: #SRTM #OpenStreetMap. #opensource software: #QGIS #SAGA. #hydrology @ihedelft

Last day #30DayMapChallenge, Day 30: Home. "Cool" district in the center of #Rotterdam where I live. #Coolsingel #Koopgoot #Westblaak #Lijnbaan #WTC. #opendata: 25 cm orthophoto draped over 50 cm #LIDAR based #DSM #AHN3 from @PDOK_online. Software: #QGIS with #Qgis2threejs plugin

#30DayMapChallenge day 1. Points. Takes me back to my days as a geophysicist.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 2 - lines. Non stop routes from @Gatwick_Airport

made in #QGIS

For today's #30DayMapChallenge I made 50 maps, because with #qgis atlas once you've made one, the other 49 are free. 

This stems from a visit to Rhode Island on the way to Boston for #FOSS4G 2017, when someone told me they grew up in a county bigger than RI.
for day 4 of #30DayMapChallenge a quick hex map of GB pubs, made using #GeoTools and rendered in #QGIS.
Day 5 #30DayMapChallenge is raster, so here is a terrain map of GB. Built using #GeoServer and #qgis and @OrdnanceSurvey open data.
Playing catchup with the #30DayMapChallenge as the hotel wifi wasn't up to big raster downloads. For day 6 - blue here is a bathymetry map.

For day 7 of the #30DayMapChallenge the subject is red, so for all my friends and relatives in the NSW Rural fire brigade is a map of the NSW bush fires. I don't normally put a scale on this sort of map but here it really helps to see those plumes are 300+km long.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 8 - Green. 

I explored the @OrdnanceSurvey open green space data and got a 1st chance to play with the #QGIS data plotly plugin. I like it a lot!

Here we can see that golf courses take up less space than religious grounds, which was a surprise.

Struggled a bit with day 9 of the #30DayMapChallenge - Yellow! 

Here is a map and chart of Rapeseed (Canola) production. As I'm allergic to the pollen I am now dreading going to Canada next year for #foss4g2020.

made with #QGIS

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10 is black and white so I went old school. Here is a map of modern Goring by Sea and the 1896 OS 6" to the mile one I used as inspiration.

made with #qgis of course!
Day 11 of #30DayMapChallenge is terrain, so I had a play with the new #QGIS 3D map view, I'm still not entirely convinced that 3D adds anything to a map but it's fun to play with,

Playing catch up with #30DayMapChallenge again, due to a combination of poor hotel wifi and a cold. So for day 12 - Movement, here is a map of % non citizen population. No real surprises except for how high Luxemburg is (but I don't think I've ever met anyone born there). #qgis

Day 13 #30DayMapChallenge is tracks, so here is a map that helps understand the pattern of railways in the SE of England, where victorian engineering drives modern house prices due to easy and hard places to build a railway.
For day 14 of #30DayMapChallenge boundaries, this is a map of the only border clearly visible from space, between North and South Korea. The change in light is unmissable.

#30DayMapChallenge day 15 - Names. A revisit to xmas 2 years ago when I played around with anagrams of GB Place names.
See https://t.co/6hixV4GhwT for more details.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 16 Places, inspired by @williamscraigm's map of GB/US place names, I was finally motivated to make a map I always think of when I'm driving on the East Coast of the US. This map shows US places (within 20km of coast) that share a name with a GB place <5km
Day 17 of #30DayMapChallenge is zones, so I've gone back to one of the big maps I used to look at in geography lessons instead of learning about glaciated valleys (again).

Day-18 of #30DayMapChallenge is globe so here is a version of yesterday's climate zones in a more "globe" like projection.  I found a vector version of the data as #QGIS is still giving me grief about reprojecting rasters to odd projections.
Day 19 of #30DayMapChallenge is urban, so here is a map of "urban" areas in the world defined by population density (from CIESIN), built with #qgis.

Day 20 of the #30DayMapChallenge is rural, I had hoped to be able to download a version of the Land Parcel Information System which each EU country constructs for CAP payments, but apparently (in GB at least) it is derived data and so can't be public (https://t.co/RlLS5JJRhE)
OK here's take 2 for the #30DayMapChallenge day 21 environment this time wholly constructed in #QGIS.

#30DayMapChallenge day 22 built environment, sadly I'd already used building density on day 20 urban. So I've gone with a dataset of human footprint from the NASA #wms server. Basically, green is good, red is bad (and I couldn't find the original data to change the colour). #qgis

Day 23 Population for #30DayMapChallenge - some small multiples of 2011 Population distribution of England and Wales by age group. Watch people age and move out of the cities.

Trying for a Pop-Art effect but not sure it really works for districts.

Day 24 of #30DayMapChallenge statistics, a new statistic to me Job Density. > 1 means more jobs than residents so there are a lot of commuters, < 1 either implies a lot of out commuting or unemployment,

#30DayMapChallenge Day 25 Climate - though this map is more an indication of where problems will occur with increasing temperature rises. 

#QGIS

Day 26 of #30DayMapChallenge is hydrology (not a subject I know anything about) so I drew a nice map of the Thames. I was going to add a profile but it seems that some sections of the river run backwards in my copy of the OpenRivers dataset!
#30DayMapChallenge day 27 - resources. Here is a map of existing wind turbines in the British Isles - unfortunately due to NIMBYs all future development is force offshore for the UK. #qgis #osm
#30DayMapChallenge, day 28 funny is back to an old favourite of mine, based on the XKCD upside down map.

#30DayMapChallenge day 29 experimental. Trying to recreate something I saw @jwoLondon (or possibly @jsndyks) do many years ago with a hand drawn look to their lines. Not sure it's really working but I have learned a lot about the geometry generator in #qgis
FInal day of #30DayMapChallenge is home, so here's a simple map of all the places I've called home over the years.

Aporte para el #30DayMapChallenge Day 7 - Estratos Socioecon√≥micos Bogot√°, Colombia - @col_en_datos #red
Lines from block centroids in Atlanta to the closest SNAP-authorized supermarket. Colors show the three major chains. Map in QGIS (with some R sprinkled in). #30DayMapChallenge

Hadn't figured out how to do these ridgeplot elevation maps yet, so used this challenge as an excuse. Probably did more work than I needed to--manually relocating sampling points based on elevation and then merging to lines. Result has an almost oblique effect. #30DayMapChallenge

#30DayMapChallenge 
Day 3: Polygons

Mapped data on SNAP benefit redemptions at authorized small retailers (gas stations/corner stores/etc.). USDA only releases these data when there are >3 stores. Quite a range for counties that had data. Analysis in #rstats, map in #QGIS.

#30DayMapChallenge 
Day 4: Hexagons

I've dipped my toes into rayshader before, but this was a chance to do so again. Here's the rate of households with median incomes >$150K in Chicago. Height and color are based on percentage. All done with #rstats.

#30DayMapChallenge
Day 5: Raster

Repurposed the data from yesterday. Here's Chicago's wealth "terrain"--the high points represent a greater rate of higher income households. Done with #qgis 3D tool and OSM overlay. Not the cleanest, but certainly tells the story.

Not quite to what I would like with today's #30DayMapChallenge (Blue), but this kind of works. It's the Chicago @Cubs historical winning percentage by city. I kind of like it better as a dot plot. Made with @Retrosheet data through #rstats and @qgis.

For #30DayMapChallenge, day 7 ("Red"), I decided to match up OSM buildings with those shown in the county records. The central portion of the county, which includes UGA, is well represented, but there's large gaps on the east side and also the northwest. Made with @QGIS.

#30DayMapChallenge: Day 8 is green

Just updated my SNAP retailer database--here's the top U.S. metros when counting dollar stores per capita.

The #30DayMapChallenge for today (Day 9) is yellow, so of course one topic came immediately to mind. Terrain here is derived from Waffle Houses per capita. There's some interesting waffle ridges through Alabama and Mississippi. Analysis w/#rstats, map w/@QGIS

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10: Black and white. I asked my first year students this week what new thing they had learned about Athens and the @universityofga since arriving. First answer: it's hilly. Here's a contour map that shows it. Made with @qgis
#30DayMapChallenge, Day 11: Elevation. I'm a data maps person by training, so this has been a good chance to sharpen skills with raster mapping. This one is just a start--detail is hard!
For day 12 of #30DayMapChallenge, the theme is movement. Here's an updated map of dollar store density from 2008-2019 at county level using SNAP authorized retailers (>95% of locations).
#30DayMapChallenge, Day 13: Tracks. Here's tornadoes for much of the last 70 years in the Southeast. Dixie Alley certainly stands out! Made with @qgis

The Georgia/Auburn game is this weekend, which raises issues of divided loyalty. For #30DayMapChallenge day 14 (boundaries), here's the lines that divide up the Southeast by proximity to SEC schools.  In Georgia, the boundary with Auburn runs from roughly Rome to Cordele.

#30DayMapChallenge, Day 15: Names. This one was a bit challenging, trying to use the wordcloud2 package in #rstats with @openstreetmap data. Here's a wordcloud of "culinary" locations in Atlanta based on OSM with a map of the city.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16 is places. I'm working with some eBird data for a final class project. A bit of a stretch for the day's theme, but here's where birds have found a place in Georgia. A whole lot of cardinals and crows.

Continuing with the eBird data analysis for today's #30DayMapChallenge (zones). Here's zones of species diversity in Athens. Playing around with drop shadow in @qgis for this one, analysis in #rstats.

Not a ton of spare time today for the #30DayMapChallenge, and also don't map global data (today's theme) very often. But here's a map of all 17,000+ Dollar Generals in the U.S. using Google Earth, showing them as the sun sets.

Today's #30DayMapChallenge theme is urban, and I used Google Earth Studio to plot a track along MetroTransit's Blue Line in Minneapolis, from the mall to downtown, then veering over to the Social Science tower and my alma mater, @UMNGeography. HD video: https://t.co/uMgrDCifGI

For the rural theme for today's #30DayMapChallenge, I developed a #shiny application for #rstats using dollar store data. Pretty much every small town in Iowa has had a Dollar General for over a decade, but Family Dollar is a new addition. Try the app at: https://t.co/8aPPaxmtzm

Environment is the theme for today's #30DayMapChallenge. Here's all forested areas in Atlanta, based on 2011 NLCD data with some SRTM hillshading thrown in. Map in @qgis
.

#30DayMapChallenge day 22: built environment. Here's all SNAP-authorized small retailers in New York City. There's a broad range of stores included in this mix, but the list on the map just about covers it. Map done in @qgis.

Day 23 of the #30DayMapChallenge is population. Working from data provided by @nhgis, here's a map of free people of color (excluding those not counted by the Census) in the U.S. in 1830. Inspired by https://t.co/sZOkXy2lPR. This map done in #rstats with #tmap.

Day 24 of the #30DayMapChallenge: Statistics. Here's a map showing the population weighted mean center of each state in the lower 48. I labeled them using the nearest identified place name from the U.S. Census. Data in #rstats. Map in @qgis.

NASA's Daymet project allows for easy downloading of climatological data. For their first lab, my intro to GIS students visualize precipitation at county level using Daymet data. For today's #30DayMapChallenge (climate), here's a version of that map.

I lived in Minnesota for 12 years and have lots of good memories of Lake Superior's north shore. For day 26 of the #30DayMapChallenge (hydrology), here's a map of the lake with the terrain inverted (depth turned to height). Map in @qgis.

#30DayMapChallenge: Resources. I've been working with three undergrads this semester on community engaged research projects. Jenny is shown here finishing quality checks on a map of resources for folks in housing transition for @SparrowsNestAth.

LOL! Here's a word cloud of the most common words in tweets containing "lol" in the U.S. I'm an #rstats native, but Python's wordcloud worked much better in this case for the masking to the shape of the U.S. Still working on frequency counts. #30DayMapChallenge, day 28: funny.

Day 29 of #30DayMapChallenge: experimental. The year is 2050. Cartographers have seized power. Alaska and Hawaii have been jettisoned. Area boundaries are now compatible with hexbinning and counties scaled to population. City names are generated from Twitter streams. All is well.
Last entry for the #30DayMapChallenge: Home. Here's the age of homes in my hometown (broadly defined) of Chicago.

Day 1 (points) of the #30DayMapChallenge. This map shows the size and construction year of all reservoirs in the Segura catchment (SE Spain), where I do most of my research.
Day 3 (polygons): These maps show the typical greening up in a mountainous Mediterranean catchment, often the result of agricultural land abandonment #30DayMapChallenge

Day 4 (hexagons): These two maps show the station density from the E-obs dataset. I haven't used this dataset yet, but was just wondering how many stations are there in our study area. Data were obtained from: https://t.co/AK3yrZRdcP #30DayMapChallenge

Day 5 (raster): Today just plain and simple a model result from the raster based model (SPHY) I'm working with, which makes use of the PCRaster framework (what's in the name). The map shows the simulated soil erosion in a subcatchment of the Segura River basin #30DayMapChallenge

Day 6 (blue): The coming days I will show some results of a climate change study we did in the Segura River basin (SE Spain). Today the change in precipitation under the business-as-usual scenario (RCP8.5), which will decrease, especially for the far future #30DayMapChallenge

Day 7 (red): Another important climate signal in the Mediterranean is heavy/extreme precipitation, which is projected to increase under climate change. This will have major consequences for the distribution of water and soil erosion, stay tuned! #30DayMapChallenge
Day 8 (green): Climate change will cause an increase in plant water stress, which is the combined effect of longer dry periods and an increase in temperature #30DayMapChallenge

Day 9 (yellow): Soil erosion is also projected to increase, mainly caused by an increase in extreme precipitation. We conclude that climate change will negatively impact water security in the Segura catchment and most likely other Mediterranean catchments #30DayMapChallenge
Day 10 (black and white): This is one from my PhD thesis and shows the study site of a field experiment, where we studied the formation of alternate bars #30DayMapChallenge

Day 11 (elevation): I made a short animation of a LiDAR image (5m resolution) of part of the study area I am working on #30DayMapChallenge 

Data obtained from: https://t.co/xnbjF9fRdK

Day 12 (movement): Today I show again some soil erosion model results. This animation shows the movement (transport) of sediment through the Taibilla catchment (SE Spain). It shows that the two reservoirs trap most of the sediment #30DayMapChallenge
Day 13 (tracks): Again one from my PhD thesis. This animation shows all the measurements I took during one field survey in a lowland stream in the Netherlands. #30DayMapChallenge
Day 14 (boundaries): Three different Mediterranean boundaries surrounding the Mediteranean Sea #30DayMapChallenge

Day 15 (names): Today I made a map that shows the locations of Mediterranean cities, from which the names also occur in other parts of the world. The size of the circles shows the frequency. The most common name is Santa Cruz, located on the island of Madeira #30DayMapChallenge

Day 16 (places): The Mediteranean has always been one of my favorite holiday destinations. Therefore today the places I have visited in the Mediterranean, which includes cities (orange dots) and islands (red) #30DayMapChallenge

Day 17 (zones): Climate zones in the Mediterranean according to the K√∂ppen classification. Of course, the Mediterranean is dominated by Mediterranean climates (Csa+Csb), but semi arid (Bsk), desert (BWh+BWk) and humid continental (Dsb) climates are also common #30DayMapChallenge
Day 18 (globe): Not only the land around the Mediterranean Sea is considered a Mediterranean ecoregion, it can also be found in California, Chile, South Africa and Australia #30DayMapChallenge

Day 19 (urban): Urban areas are rapidly expanding in the Mediterranean. These maps show how urban areas have expanded between 1990 and 2018 in 12 of the largest cities in the Mediterranean #30DayMapChallenge

Day 20 (rural): The Mediterranean is characterized by complex rural patterns, mainly dominated by agriculture. There is a high percentage of irrigated agriculture due to low annual precipitation. This percentage will most likely increase in the future #30DayMapChallenge

Day 21 (environment): These maps show the habitat and flow patterns of 4 pristine lowland streams in central Poland. The data were obtained in a field campaign in 2011. We also took macroinvertebrate samples and mapped terrestrial vegetation #30DayMapChallenge

Day 22 (built environment): All buildings in the city of Murcia (Spain), colored according to the year of construction. The map is centered around Plaza Circular, one of the main squares of the city #30DayMapChallenge

Day 23 (population): The population in the Mediterranean has steadily increased in the last 20 years. However, there are also areas where population density is decreasing, like in rural areas in Turkey #30DayMapChallenge

Day 24 (statistics): These maps show three methods of visualizing uncertainty in maps. Today I also have published a new a blog post in which I explain these methods and discuss their pros and cons: https://t.co/bnyQY2Gm0r #30DayMapChallenge

Day 25 (climate): The Mediterranean Basin is names as one of the primary Hot Spots for climate change. These two maps summarize the climate of the Mediterranean of the last 30 years, with an obvious increase in temperature #30DayMapChallenge

Day 26 (hydrology): I made a map interpretation of the water balance equation (R = P - ET - ŒîS). As you can see, most water is evaporated in water scare regions, such as here the southeast of Spain #30DayMapChallenge

Day 27 (resources): 577 large reservoirs have been built in the Mediterranean Basin, with a total capacity of 252 km¬≥. From these reservoirs, 48% are used for irrigation, 25% for hydroelectricity production and 13% for drinking water supply #30DayMapChallenge
Day 28 (funny): Today's map was mostly made by a next generation map maker, so I'm cheating a bit. In any case, we had a lot of fun! #30DayMapChallenge
Day 29 (experimental): I have been playing around with #blender to make a representation of a typical Mediterranean catchment #30DayMapChallenge

The last day of the #30DayMapChallenge (home): All the places I've called home.

It was a lot of fun making all these maps. But also useful, exploring new datasets for future research. Most maps were made with #rstats and #ggplot2. Thanks to @tjukanov and all the participants!

#30DayMapChallenge Day 15: Names

VT towns were required by law to look after their own poor/disabled. This led to "poor farms." Although the last one closed in 1968 & some towns renamed their "Poor (or Town) Farm Road" other towns did not, so this vestige of VT history remains.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 1 - points.

All UK schools / colleges / universities based on data from their (mandatory) Food Safety Inspection.

Nothing fancy - just HTML5 canvas. Mainly because I have no idea what I am doing ..

#30DayMapChallenge Day 2 - lines.

UK Holiday Time

I fly my helicopter straight to the nearest hotel / b&b that has a Food Safety rating "Requiring Improvement"

From there I fly to the next nearest and so on. Then home.

Still just canvas. But with a projection this time.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 3 - polygons.

Mapping By Hotel

Making polygons of the UK's outline by:
1) Taking the geolocations of all hotels (from Food Safety Ratings).
2) Declustering them (to get mainland / islands).
3) Drawing a concave hull around each cluster.

The real #30DayMapChallenge map I wanted to make is this - solidarity from Dublin to those out on #UCUstrikes all over the place, you're not alone and I hope the map highlights strikes as collective response to neoliberal, individualising and immiserating university structures ‚úä
#30DayMapChallenge #Day2 - Irish waterways as lines using @openstreetmap and #QGIS.
#30DayMapChallenge #Day3 - Dublin buildings as polygons using @openstreetmap data and #QGIS. I especially like how the new build dockland courtyard developments look like square doughnuts.

And now that I'm (literally just there) caught up on #30DayMapChallenge, may I present #Day4, in which I break my black-and-white streak to do a hexagon map of @InsideAirbnb Sep 2019 listings data in Dublin City. 300x300m hexagonal bins smooth the 150m point randomisation effect.

#30DayMapChallenge #Day5 - @CopernicusEU Corine raster - gif of "urban" Dublin. Please enjoy my urban/not urban classification, simplifying Corine code system and making urban studies folk (incl me) cringe üòÖ But this is how "urban" landuse gets coded from satellite data y'all...

So I fell off the #30DayMapChallenge there - but back at it again (now minus an appendix üòÖ) with #Day6 Blue and #Day7 Red. Water bodies for blue and for my red map, an example of how red has historic and current 'weightiness' in colour psychology of (mis)mapping. Spot my errors?

So I fell off the #30DayMapChallenge there - but back at it again (now minus an appendix üòÖ) with #Day6 Blue and #Day7 Red. Water bodies for blue and for my red map, an example of how red has historic and current 'weightiness' in colour psychology of (mis)mapping. Spot my errors?

Sticking with CSO data on #Day8 of #30DayMapChallenge - for 'the emerald isle', it strikes me that we've not many placenames with 'green' (or 'glas' üáÆüá™) so that's what I'm highlighting. I definitely find themed map-making more zen than daytime tv for post-appendix op recovery...

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 9 - Yellow doesn't seem a popular colour for single-hue maps, but using it here to map global banana trade market in #QGIS, using UN 2018 Preliminary Banana Market Review data üçåEU countries apparently mad for them, with ~33% of all global banana imports

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10 B&W - using #QGIS, #OSM. Prison stripe colours? Irish prison data! üßê Co-location makes some of the labels a bit confused. Sidenote - OSM data for Midlands Prison is VERY detailed, what's the story? Is someone using OA maps to plan jailbreak?

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 11 - Channeling my inner physical geographer with @NASA 90m SRTM elevation Data (thanks to @cgiarcsi for this very cool global + open access resource) to show Dublin as a land/water-scape from harbour to mountains.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 15 #OSM hilly placenames in #QGIS. Crock and Knock both come from 'Cnoc', Irish for 'hill'. I knew Crock was more common north but wasn't aware of clear split. @NASA 90m SRTM baselayer confirms - most 'hill places' have hills. We're a literal people üòÖ

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16, buffering #OSM places in #QGIS - areas in white are more than 1km from a 'place' point, so I'm mapping place/not place here. Shows OSM coverage skew nicely I think, with bit of an East-West divide but Cavan/Monaghan has lit OSM community it seems ü§î

#30DayMapChallenge Day 17 - Zones. Fellow traveler, you've no idea how oddly frustrating but satisfying but still frustrating it was to georeference and reproduce Burgess' famous 1925 zonal Chicago map. The labelling takes so long that you REALLY get time to question the logic üò©

#30DayMapChallenge #Day18 Globe - as an avant garde statement in favour of globes, I've gone a bit around my elbow by mapping Magellan-Elcano's famed first circumnavigation... of a CUBE. Because a globe would make this much clearer, ya know?

#30DayMapChallenge Day 19 - urban - using @CSOIreland settlement data and #OSM placenames, I'm mapping places with 'bally' in their name. 'Bally' comes from 'Baile' or town, so I like to think of this as the Irish language map of urban Ireland, which pays the border little mind.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 20 - Rural - Here's a map of Dublin County Council development plan zoning for rural use. "Rural" is relative, but it'll be interesting to track what happens with these areas and uses longer term.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 21 - Environment - Mapping peatbog environments in Ireland and UK using Corine land cover data. Kept thinking of that Simon and Garfunkel song but as 'Looking for fun and feeling boggy, Ba da-da da-da da-da, feeling boggy' üé∂üòÖ

#30DayMapChallenge, late in the Day 22. Built environment. Comparing #OSM building data map coverage in Dublin and Cork. Both are at same scale but Cork coverage is much patchier üßê The People's Republic could probably do with more Open Street Mappers, like...

#30DayMapChallenge Day 23 - Map of 'ordinary' European cities, with populations between 50,000 and 500,000, using Eurostat data. Not that big, not that small, just where and how loads of Europeans live.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 24 - Mapping Census 2016 ED statistics for one-person households and children born after 9/11 as % of ED households/populations. Interesting to see one-person households are basically not a thing in Dublin commuter belt and just how many born post-9/11.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 25 - Climate - Mapping two things that contribute to climate change in EU using Eurostat data - national greenhouse gas emissions per capita AND bovine üêÑ populations as % of total EU28 cows. Ireland, punching above our weight with both üò™
#30DayMapChallenge Day 26 is hydrology - here's a map of EPA bathing locations and 2019 water quality data. Rule of thumb is, if the logo is darker, dip or sip with caution...

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 27 - I didn't almost forget to do a map... Mapping water as resource, using GSI groundwater bedrock aquifer data. Regionally important aquifers can do large public water supply. Locally important do for smaller public supplies or group water schemes.

#30DayMapChallenge - Day 28 - Just for fun, the locations and shooting ranges of Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown Martello Towers. If South Dublin ever secedes and is defending itself from coastal invasion, we could try planning the landings from this ü§î

A day late üò™ with this experimental #30DayMapChallenge map of Irish Times 'Priced out' property coverage BUT to be fair I've been trying to find a good way to nail explaining these maps on and off for about a year so it's very experimental altogether... More detail below -1/3

Ending #30DayMapChallenge, here's day 30, home. I thought about this one for a while and want to take the opportunity to highlight Irish Housing Assistance Payment data - these households need homes, not to be 'housing need met' by state funding of private rental #housingforall
Circular migration plot showing human movement in 2005-10 #science #30DayMapChallenge day 11: movement
