Relative length and direction is interesting as is Mt St Helens station density.

We‚Äôre taking part in the #30DayMapChallenge, not sure whether we can do every day but we‚Äôre going to try as many as we can. So to kick off the month here‚Äôs Mount St Helens in halftone. The topic was ‚Äúpoints‚Äù, this may be a bit of a stretch‚Ä¶ #lovemaps #cartography
Day 2 of the #30DayMapChallenge is about lines, so here‚Äôs one we did a few years ago, showing the highway network in The Netherlands as an abstraction. #lovemaps #cartography

Another blast from the past for today‚Äôs #30DayMapChallenge. The theme is polygons so here‚Äôs a map of the Antarctic claims (in the 1950s!) that I did for an academic publication. Thanks to this I got several more commissions for similar maps. #lovemaps #cartography

Today‚Äôs #30DayMapChallenge theme is ‚Äúraster‚Äù. I still had a terrain model of the Marianas Trench and surrounding areas on my hard drive, so I used Photoshop and @Avenza Geographic Imager to turn it into a neat map. #map #lovemaps #cartography

Low inspiration for today‚Äôs #30DayMapChallenge theme, blue. But since Dutch street name signs are generally blue I mined some data and mapped the Dutch municipalities based on the number of streets with ‚Äúblue‚Äù in the name. Breda, my birthplace, won! #map #lovemaps #cartography

Today‚Äôs #30DayMapChallenge theme is ‚Äúred‚Äù. Here‚Äôs a map of all the (successful‚Ä¶) landers and rovers that have been active on Mars. I used a Viking mosaic with added MOLA shaded relief in the EqualEarth projection by @MtnMapper and @BojanSavric #lovemaps #cartography #map #mars

I went old-school for the #30DayMapChallenge today! The theme was ‚Äúblack and white‚Äù, which I interpreted as pure 1-bit and I limited myself to the resolution of my first computer monitor: a 720 x 348 Hercules greyscale one #lovemaps #cartography #mapping #pixelmapping

Today‚Äôs #30DayMapChallenge theme is ‚Äúelevation‚Äù. While we may not have much of it here in The Netherlands it doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs all flat. The Limburg panhandle has some rather cheeky little climbs, which I like to bike, and a lot of them are captured here. #cartography #lovemaps

The #30daymapchallenge theme for today is ‚ÄúMovement‚Äù. So here‚Äôs *just* the layer of ocean currents from a map (centered on the Pacific) I made a few years ago. When working on it the linework grabbed me. #lovemaps #cartography

The theme ‚Äútracks‚Äù of the #30daymapchallenge immediately made me think of railroad tracks, so here‚Äôs a map of the most iconic one in the world, the Trans-Siberian Railroad! #cartography #maps #lovemaps

When the #30daymapchallenge theme is ‚Äúboundaries‚Äù I of course have to mention the crazy Dutch/Belgian enclaves of Baarle-Nassau and Baarle-Hertog. The newly opened bypass road crosses an international border no less than 8 times in just 2 miles #cartography #lovemaps

The #30DayMapChallenge today is about names. So I figured I‚Äôd re-use a typographic map I had made of Ile de la Cite and Ile Saint-Louis in Paris. All text placed by hand, takes time but I love to do it that way. I feel the output quality is a lot higher. #lovemaps #cartography

The #30DayMapChallenge theme for today is Globe and it just so happens we made a few. Here‚Äôs One Stop Map team member (and sponsored cyclcross rider) Veerle showing off the BalancePlanet globe (Want one? Check out https://t.co/yt5LOPjQCA). #lovemaps #cartography #globe #globes

The #30daymapchallenge goes urban today, and I just happened to have an early 2019 building dataset for an entire city on my hard drive. Here‚Äôs Utrecht, colour-coded by year-of-construction. #map #cartography #lovemaps

The #30DayMapChallenge theme for today is ‚Äúrural‚Äù and that hits home for me, being from a small village. Here‚Äôs the artificial archipelago formed by Dutch municipalities with a majority of their population classed as rural #cartography #lovemap

We recently produced a series of maps of large urban regions, so with today‚Äôs #30DayMapChallenge theme being ‚ÄúBuilt Environment‚Äù we thought it would be a good one to show. Here‚Äôs San Francisco, head over to https://t.co/vMJrtfIvU2 to see what else we have in store! #lovemaps

We‚Äôve seen many gorgeous LIDAR maps of rivers (e.g. by @geo_coe and @Carto_ALex) so with the #30DayMapChallenge theme being Hydrology we wanted to do something similar. Not a river but the tidal wetlands of the ‚ÄúVerdronken Land van Saeftinge‚Äù #lovemaps #cartography

My submission for #30DayMapChallenge Day 1 - points
@RideIndego bike share station Q3 checkouts in #Philadelphia (cc #bikephl)
CSV data from @opendataphilly ; Map produced in #QGIS 3.8
h/t to @geomenke for teaching me how to import a CSV with lat/longs üòÄ

My submission for #30DayMapChallenge day 2 - lines:
Commuter rail (not Amtrak) in northeastern US. Some data was hard to find (esp @MTA). I've taken these lines from Wilmington DE to New Haven CT. Shows how challenging #railroad is in US. #Map produced in #QGIS 3.8.

My submission for #30DayMapChallenge Day 3 - Polygons
Uninsured (i.e. no health insurance) rates for #Delaware. Polygons are #census block groups, smaller than tracts. I'd like to do a lot more with combining multiple socioeconomic factors at the most granular level available.

My submission for #30DayMapChallenge Day 4 - Hexagons
Trash-related 311 calls in #Philadelphia. All @philly311 calls from @opendataphilly csv, filtered by service type & aggregated to hexbin (using #QGIS Create Grid tool)
*Disclaimer - a few dozen of those calls were made by me

#30DayMapChallenge Day 6 - Blue
#Bathymetry #map from Natural Earth data, nested polygons for depths to 10000m. Each layer is the same color, but blending mode (multiply) creates depth. I also made a point to use #EqualEarthProjection. 
Made in #QGIS 3.8

#30DayMapChallenge Day 7: Red
Urban land cover (red) in #Pennsylvania using @USGSLandCover and @USGS DEM rendered in hillshade; I liked the results so much I made a 2nd #map for #Virginia
I changed the land cover style using colors from @PetersonGIS Carto Toolkit
Tools: #QGIS 3.8

#30DayMapChallenge Day 8 - Green
This is protected public lands in #Delaware. Lots of wildlife areas along the bay. All data from @FirstMap; downloaded shapefile, then added a Map Server basemap, of course I blended the two (I ‚ô•Ô∏è Multiply)
Made in #QGIS 3.8

#30DayMapChallenge Day 9: Yellow
Places with "sun" in the name, per query of @USGS @USGSTNM GNIS place name file.
I've used National #Map data to make maps before, but I've learned so much more just this month, h/t @tjukanov 
Made in #QGIS 3.8

For today's #30DayMapChallenge (B&W) I updated a minimalist #map I made a few years ago: All road lines in #Delaware. I exported a high-res image (600dpi) too so I could zoom in and really see all the places I grew up in. Data from @uscensusbureau, made in #QGIS 3.8

For today's #30DayMapChallenge I'm doubling down on my land cover #maps from a few days ago. This is #Vermont which has a lot of elevation and very few people, one of the most beautiful places I've ever visited. Data from @USGS @USGSTNM made in #QGIS 3.8

#30DayMapChallenge 12: Movement. Migration into southern New Castle County #Delaware as seen by changes in @USGSLandCover 2001-16. They were very small towns until c. 1995 then growth explosion started. #Map made in #QGIS and GIF made in GIMP. I really love how this turned out!

#30DayMapChallenge: Boundaries
In #Delaware there is a little-known set of boundaries known as Hundreds. Once used for elections, they now only exist for property assessments. Thus an old-style color palette. Data: @FirstMap, info: Del. Geological Survey, map: in #QGIS 3.8.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 15: Names
This is a #map of all the towns in #Connecticut that have similar names. There are a lot of "North"s, "New"s etc. Notable is how East Hampton is actually west of Hampton. Not sure how that happened..
Made in #QGIS with @uscensusbureau data

For today's #30DayMapChallenge - Places: My extremely limited travels, only ever within the US, mostly along the east coast with only a few trips west of the Appalachians. #Map in #QGIS 3.8. I'm loving playing with antique-looking styles & shapeburst Thx @PetersonGIS

For #30DayMapChallenge Zones, I couldn't resist a bad #map of the Zone Improvement Plan (ZIP) Codes, IMHO the worst way to show data. This is ZIPs in southeast PA with municipal & county boundaries & all ZIPs intersecting. Thx to @CARTO for the great article about them..

#30DayMapChallenge 18 - Globe:
An orthographic projection #map I made a few years ago based on @underdarkGIS @PetersonGIS tutorial; centered on #Philadelphia and its antipode. Data from Natural Earth, made in #QGIS 2.x

#30DayMapChallenge 19: Urban
I took the commuter rail #map from Day 2 and added the @USGSLandCover data to it. (Also added the NHS line in CT). Really neat to see how population centers line up with the tracks - a real-life "which came first". This is one of my favorites :)

#30DayMapChallenge 20: Rural
Another GIF #map of @USGSLandCover in #Delaware. Sussex County is mostly rural but has been growing steadily. I did some calcs of LC and got an ratio of rural cells in the raster for each year. Still quite rural but (literally) losing ground..

#30DayMapChallenge 21: Environment
The #Delaware River basin land cover & hillshade, with inverted polygon shapeburst for cool drop shadow effect. Made in #QGIS 3.8 w/ @USGSLandCover & DEM

#30DayMapChallenge 22: Built environment:
Impervious cover in #Philadelphia, using @opendataphilly layer, aggregated into hexbins. I calculated % of impervious, natural, and water in each hex & displayed each in its own layer, blended together in #QGIS for this effect (neat!)

#30DayMapChallenge 23: Population
A variation on #election #maps: returns at county level, but instead of dot density (h/t @kennethfield) or my earlier value-by-alpha, I used @USGSLandCover as a mask; developed is transparent, other areas are masking full county polygon

#30DayMapChallenge 24: Statistics
Age vs poverty in PHL metro region. An inverse relationship, hypothesizing that younger people are more prone to higher poverty. Data at block group level from @uscensusbureau, h/t @jscarto for bivariate how-to

#30DayMapChallenge 25: Climate
My home state of #Delaware (max elevation 448ft/137m) seen as the waters rise meter by meter üò™
Data from @USGS, map made in #QGIS 3.8, animated in GIMP

#30DayMapChallenge 26: Hydrology
A simple side-by-side map of Philadelphia's streams, historic and current. So much of the city has been paved over, most streams are underground now. I added hillshade for visual effect. Data from @opendataphilly and @USGS

#30DayMapChallenge 27: Resources
Chickens! Literally hundreds of millions of chickens on the Delmarva Peninsula. Data from @USDA Census of Agriculture
Map made in #QGIS 3.8

#30DayMapChallenge 28: Funny
Since it's #Thanksgiving in the US, I made this #map of places with favorite #food items in their names. Turkey, Corn, Pumpkin, and my personal favorite: Cranberry. Yummy!! Enjoy :)
Data from @USGS @USGSTNM, made in #QGIS 3.8

#30DayMapChallenge 29: Experimental
The borders of #Maryland are, in many places, the result of losing just about every border dispute ever. Here are some of those losses and what the state might look like had it won them..
#Map made in #QGIS 3.8

For the final #30DayMapChallenge 
I live in Philadelphia now, but home will always be where I grew up in the suburbs of northern Delaware. Here's a map of where I lived, went to school, and worked for many years before moving on to the big city.
Thx @tjukanov

Day 1 of the #30DayMapChallenge.  Points was the map...so we went with some simple points of airports visited in October.  #IMNOS
Day 2 of the #30DayMapChallenge.  Lines...Since we did the points of the airports in October, will add the lines in #IMNOS for the routes.
Day 3 of the #30DayMapChallenge:  Polygons‚Ä¶ZipCode polygons for US Census data of what percentage of renters live in the SF Bay area.  #IMNOS
Day 4 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Hexagons‚Ä¶Impacts of flooding on traffic from Hurricane Harvey in 2017  #IMNOS
Day 5 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Raster‚Ä¶Looking at #NASAsedac data for global crop lands‚Ä¶and thinking of the opportunities for #IoT in agriculture.  #IMNOS
Day 6 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Blue‚Ä¶Went to IMNOS-MT for this one since I love the blue background maps for night view.  #IMNOS
Day 7 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Red‚Ä¶GTFS Data Inclusion with thematic on the Chicago Metro Red Line.  #IMNOS
Day 8 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Going Green! @EUEnvironment country data on percentage of municipal waste recycled 2014‚Ä¶probably higher now.  #IMNOS
Day 9 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Yellow‚Ä¶Implemented some quick data from @Team_eBird on the Yellow-bellied Sapsucker territory  #IMNOS
Day 10 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Black & White‚Ä¶ #IMNOS Dark Theme with @NASAEarthData for City Lights across the globe.
Day 11 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Elevation‚Ä¶Not sure why I need Antenna elevation LOS over the Ocean, but possible anyways.  #IMNOS
Day 12 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Movement‚Ä¶Using @wsferries GTFS current vehicle positions to track movement of ferries through automated #IMNOS widgets.
Day 13 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Tracks‚Ä¶Moving from boats to train tracks with @cta live train data over gtfs track information.  #IMNOS
Day 14 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Boundaries‚Ä¶Fire Perimeter boundaries provided by @USGS to help maintain wireless networks focusing on impacted areas.  #IMNOS
Day 15 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Names‚Ä¶Ran a search for "Names" in #IMNOS and this what came back.  Namestovo it is.
Day 16 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Places‚Ä¶Some places on where to go to find some seismic activity over the last 60 days from @USGS‚Ä¶or where not to go.  #IMNOS

Day 17 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Zones‚Ä¶Simple Global TimeZones (prefacing Day 18) map for a view of every timezone the team also supports!  ‚Ä¶and why do we have #DaylightSavingsTime still?  #IMNOS
Day 18 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Globe‚Ä¶Places in the globe that can benefit from the #IMNOS Team.  Couldn't do this without their platform flexibility.
Day 19 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Urban‚Ä¶Probability of urban expansion by 2030 from #NASAsedac data.  Network planning for a little past tomorrow.  #IMNOS

Day 20 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Rural‚Ä¶Population density areas from #NASAsedac with urban extents overlaid.  All the areas we need initiatives like @TelecomInfraP to drive connectivity outside of urban.  #IMNOS
Day 21 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Environment‚Ä¶US Current drought conditions from @NOAA‚Ä¶lets hope water doesn't become the new gold.  #IMNOS
Day 22 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Built Environment‚Ä¶Landuse from @nycgov PLUTO open data.  Fair amount of green in the urban jungle.  #IMNOS
Day 23 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Population‚Ä¶Populations density data overlaid with the world at night.  23 Days in, having to recycle a few layers utilization here and there.  #IMNOS
Day 24 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Statistics‚Ä¶Fast data binning, statistics, analytics, and visualization with the #GeoSpatialCore to make map data much more interactive and custom.  #IMNOS
Day 25 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Climate‚Ä¶All the beautiful rain last week at home in the valley of the sun from @NOAA  #IMNOS
Day 26 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Hydrology‚Ä¶Water Basins from the @USGS.  We'll zoom to the one's where I grew up with.  #IMNOS
Day 27 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Resources‚Ä¶Global Major Mineral Deposits (aka some Natural Resources) from around the globe via @USGS  #IMNOS
Day 28 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Funny‚Ä¶Some bad map humor for Thanksgiving Day in the US at the expense of all my friends in Turkiye  #IMNOS

Day 29 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Experimental‚Ä¶Using tablets for map analysis works great, experimenting on how to make it a little better for wireless network analysis on a regular cell phone and will need a little more work or some smaller fingers. üòÄ #IMNOS
Day 30 of the #30DayMapChallenge :  Home‚Ä¶The home neighborhood I attempt to keep complete and up to date in @OpenStreetMap and 30 days complete!  #IMNOS

Crashes and accidents on New Zealand, roads recorded by the NZ Police. Data: NZTA, made with QGIS.

Bright Lights of Population ‚Äî usually resident population density. Data: Statistics NZ (https://t.co/WHVU03T1zV), made with QGIS.

Playful Topographic Map of the Chatham Islands ‚Äì Lagoons, Sand, Swamps & Forests.

Electric Blue ‚Äì transmission lines supported by pylons. Data: LINZ (https://t.co/peyVJ0VtAO)

*Green* ‚Äì the 100 longest roads in New Zealand with the word ‚Äúgreen‚Äù in them.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 9: Yellow

Hoiho ‚Äî distribution of Hoiho / Yellow-Eyed Penguin in New Zealand waters. Data: MPI via NABIS.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10: Black and White:

Three Waters ‚Äî B&W schematic of water, waste and storm reticulation under a small part of Auckland‚Äôs inner suburbs. Data Auckland Council.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 11: Elevation

EQNZ ‚Äì New Zealand elevation as graphic equalizer bars. Data LINZ (https://t.co/peyVJ1d4sm), made with QGIS.

#30DayMapChallenge becoming more challenging now we are at day 10. Today's them is black and white which can mean grayscale too right? #snowdonia made with #qgis and a bit of #b3d .
#30DayMapChallenge. Day 11. Elevation. Mount Etna.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 13: Tracks. Not had much time today and seem to have lost most of my GPS tracks but here are some of my remaining ski tracks from last year
#30DayMapChallenge Day 14, boundaries
#30DayMapChallenge Day 15 - Names. So using #osm, I decided to take a quick look at streets named like me! #samuel

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16 - Places. Not much time today so just a re-post of previous project, but this is all the gig places and bands that I have been to see over the years
https://t.co/uNCu7U4GEq
#30DayMapChallenge Day 17 theme is zones, so I made some random isochrones in #qis using data from @HEREmaps and #osm
#30DayMapChallenge day 18 theme is globe so I took a quick look at different projections of the world

Day 19 theme of the #30DayMapChallenge  is Urban. I have done a quick render of Birmingham to show the new Index of Multiple Deprivation. Put together in #qgis and a bit of #b3d, with data clipped using @OrdnanceSurvey #zoomstack buildings.

#30DayMapChallenge and today is Rural. Not sure this attempt fully worked, but my first go at 'hand-drawn' style and using geometry generator in #qgis to try proportional bucket fills on a hexagon-cartogram....

Not been able to anything today for #30DayMapChallenge other than an extremely rough and quick render of Sutton Park. At 2,400 acres it is apparently the largest urban park in Europe and - according to local legend - home to Barkfoot.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 22 for built environment I looked at heathrow and gatwick airports

#30DayMapChallenge Day 23: Population. Last year, for awork task, i followed an excellent post by @undertheraedar on using #qgis atlas by field. So for today I quickly copied it again to show GLA's updated population projections

#30DayMapChallenge Day 24: Statistics. Not been able to do any new maps today, so instead I had a quick look at my #osm edits and my stats for @TheMissingMaps. I need to get back on this for 2020, or maybe we make this project next months #30DayMapChallenge.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 25: Climate. Didn't have much of an idea where to go on this one and then something literally hit me in the face on the way home from work. So i managed to put at least something together albeit in a bit of a rush.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 26: Hydrology. Quickly cobbled together some Tuscan waterways and rivers in #qgis

#30DayMapChallenge Day 27: Resources.  Busy attending another excellent @longitude_space event tonight so no time for a new map. Instead I have just done a colour version of my Day 10 submission looking at mines and quarries in #Snowdonia
#30DayMapChallenge Day 28.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 29: Experimental. Yet again hardly any time to do anything other than my first quick dabble at lego-esque brick styles
#30DayMapChallenge Day 30: Home. Three cities which I have been able to call home at various points.

#30DayMapChallenge 1. Points. I chose those points that are meaningful to me. I'm really doing this! Took me 15 min to do the map with QGIS and 15 min to figure out suitable size for TwitterüòÖ. Hope I'm set for the whole month challengeü§™The game is on @tjukanov.

Day 2, lines #30DayMapChallenge. The lines I have been travelling inside my home town last month. The data is based on my calendar and purchaces and #openstreetmap. Paths are opt.for bus and car with #QGIS #OSMtool. It is not the whole truth but close. My life in a nutshell.
Day 3: #30DayMapChallenge, polygons. My habitat area in my town, based on places I've visited and routes I've travelled in October. This is becoming so sadüôà.

Day 4, #30DayMapChallenge, hexagons. This could become a rug or maybe bathroom floor tiling!?! Hexagons grid with #QGIS joined by location with my #openstreetmap paths from my journey to train stations, bus, school, shops and home.

@tjukanov #30DayMapChallenge Day 5: raster. I'm so bad with raster data and almost quit. So I just used @Maanmittaus basic map & dem to make a treasure map of my Island. There is a rumor,that long long time ago,pirates tried to steal a rich land owners treasure,but he hid it somewhere...ü§´

@tjukanov #30DayMapChallenge 6. Blue. Since I never leave my home town (apparently), I tested how QGIS renders shading on lines. It makes the roads look like blood veins. And river Aura is the main source of blue life in our city.

#30DayMapChallenge 7. Red. Traffic accidents @Turkukaupunki during 2011-2017 from @Tilastokeskus. It took me way too long with this map, hate labeling. But point clustering method in styling with QGIS is quite handy. I also learned a lot which is the best part of the challenge!

#30DayMapChallenge day 8. Super Green! Parks in @Turkukaupunki from OpenStreetMap. Made my own tree symbol. Jei! Buildings from NLS-FI topographic database. Tools: QGIS, QuickOSM and some blending tests.

#30DayMapChallenge day 9. Yellow. As the only right (cultural) capital in Finland, here are the places of culture near river Aura in @Turkukaupunki based on OSM and joined with building data from NLS-FI. Other possible yellow things considered: toiletsüòõ. Made with QGIS with üíõ.

#30DayMapChallenge day 10 B & W. Fathers day in Finland, so thought about suitable gift to my dad. I rarely change the north angle, but seemed suitable with the grid plan of our town. Buildings from NLS-FI.
#30DayMapChallenge day 11. Failed in elevation :D. This could be also considered: Experimental.

#30DayMapChallenge day 12. Ok, this is getting trickier. I had to get out of my comfort zone & step out of Finland. a) data with time is not easy to acquire, b) animations need some experience. Here is my first attempt to use GIMP. It went the wrong wayüòÄ. Data USGS, earthquakes.

#30DayMapChallenge day 13. Not even in the half way and this challenge is wearing me downüòú. Tracks. Or track of a certain blue whale somewhere in the Pacific. No idea what he/she did. And some odd arrow lines, just for fun. This. Is. Experimental. Indeed.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 14. Boundaries. I tried to test how to make a nice world map with boundaries ==>So here is a world without boundaries. Also noticed that QGIS has "some" issues with odd projections. Data: natural earth countries, projection: World Equidistant Conic

#30DayMapChallenge Day 15. Names. I'll be classical. All the swear words I have uttered during this challenges as places in Finland. Other commonly used swearwords as places, but did not enter the map are: dick/kyrp√§ (130), satan/saatana (3) and ars/perse (331). Sorry about this.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16. Places. My place. Center of Universe. 

Data form NLS-FI, buildings, centroid, classified by its use. 

I think I'm going to frame this.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 16. Zones. In da Zone. While doing yesterdays challenge, I noticed that there is an interesting pattern in the center zone of my home town. Used QGIS blending modes to enhance it. The empty spot in the middle is a large park area and empty line a river.üßø

#30DayMapChallenge Day 18.-20. in one go, since we had a huge GIS party for the past two days in Finland. And @tjukanov taught me how to do a Turku centered globe with QGIS üôèSo, globe, urban and rural at the same time. It is a mess, I know, but had to jump back in the game.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 21. Environment. Tree database of Helsinki. Trees classified by their max height. Looked nicer in QGIS layout composer and U think this could be something that I could work with a bit more :)

#30DayMapChallenge Day 22. Built environment. I was supposed to give you a nice 3Dgif with buildings from Helsinki CityGML. BUT. I had an aquarium accident today and a üåä. So here is just a bunny I found from Turku. District M√§likk√§l√§. Data: Topographic database @Maanmittaus

#30DayMapChallenge Day 23. Population balls. Data: Natural Earth. Population data is boring without accurate and precise information. In Finland open data is aggregated to municipal borders, 250*250 m grid also exists, but it costs. 100*100 m grid only for research.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 24. Statistics. Finland is the promised land for summer cottages. Here are top 6 postal code areas with over 40 cottages/km2. I live in one of them (Kakskerta, 50 cottages/km2). Data: Paavo postal code areas from @Tilastokeskus. Made with QGIS Atlas tool.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 25. Climate. Today I shall be very lazy and just give you this: a test result from climate tool made with @TREyleiskaava, Ubigu Ltd and Tietotakomo. I made the visualisations for QGIS and my colleagues did the actual work :) 2019-2035: CO2 emissions.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 26. Hydrology. As usual, I tried a lot of things from Teno river meanders to sea level fluctuations. And what did I come up with in the end? Africa. QGIS, natural earth rivers, mask for continent. Interesting also to notice that no rivers in Sahara. Daaa ü§∑Ô∏è

#30DayMapChallenge Day 27. Resources. The challenge is soon over, and I think I have found my niche. Seeing patterns in all data. Here is an open data source from Finland by @metsakeskus (huge effort!) and I tested it today. Only to find out that I live inside a forest gnome.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 28. Fun. All my maps have been fun, so no I made something serious. Most recent Big foot sightings reported to https://t.co/d6MnmFA88O. Sights reported between 08-11/2019, covering sights of 1985-2019. Sorry about the screenscraping. County data by US GOV.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 29. All. most. done. Experimental. During this challenge I have experimented a lot. A lot more than I thought. This was supposed to be posted on the day the hydrology challenge was acute. But I'll take the opportunity now. *

#30DayMapChallenge Day 30. Home. Doneü•≥. This was exhausting but fun :) Here is my home. Home is a place to relax and work. And during the summers I try to maintain the garden. The map is a revision of my garden map posted earlier this year. Some things have changed since then :)

A map of line plots of #snow cover duration (derived from MODIS, 2000-2016) for Otago. Shameless #joyplot, I guess it fits the line theme for #30DayMapChallenge

#30DayMapChallenge day 5, raster. Here are 6: raster principal components of snow cover duration anomaly for the Clutha Catchment, NZ. These show the most important spatial patterns from a 16 year time series of daily snow cover from MODIS. #remotesensing

Day 11 of the #30DayMapChallenge is elevation, so I revived an old experiment. The contour of 90 days of #snow cover per year for the Clutha Catchment, NZ. Symbolised by elevation. It's weird, but interesting. Snow cover data is from MODIS. #spatial #remotesensing ‚ùÑÔ∏èüèÇüèîÔ∏è

#30DayMapChallenge day 12, movement. A winter (2015) of airflow to the Pisa Range, Central Otago. Trajectories from the @NOAA hysplit model, which I ran via a matlab wrapper (which also plots the maps and makes the animation) #spatial #climate #snow #NZ

#30DayMapChallenge day 14, boundaries. A map of "big" order 7 - 8 catchments (from @mfe_news river environments classification) in the South Island, symbolised by boundary elevation.  Useful clue for thinking about different hydrological regimes? #hydrology #spatial #rivers #nz

#30DayMapChallenge day 18: globe. Global #lightning climatology, average "flashes" per km2 per year (1998-2015), detected by satellites. Data from @NASA Global Hydrology Resource Center #spatial #remotesensing #mapping

#30DayMapChallenge Day 5. Raster 

Remember: Many raster layers are just used for analysis or are intermediate results. There is no need to put them in a map for others to see.

Categorical raster maps in which categories do not appear in large chunks tend to be pretty useless.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 6. Blue

Don't use single color palettes for qualitative information.

Color values (lightness) can be ordered, and that might give the impression that some categories are better or have more importance than others. Use color hue instead.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 7/8. Red/Green

Most color blind people have red/green color blindness. Take that into account and avoid things such as the color ramp used in the map below.

Also, don't use a divergent color ramp when your data is not divergent.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 10. Black and White.

The legend is part of the map. If possible, put it within the map itself to better use the available space, not isolated from it. In the image below, (a) is right, (b) is wrong

#30DayMapChallenge  Day 11. Elevation

A common layer computed from elevation data is aspect. Rendering aspect with a regular color ramp (as in the image below) is not the best way of doing it. Aspect is a cyclic variable, and a cyclic color ramp should be used

Had zero time for day 1 of the #30daymapchallenge, so here are street trees of the City of Los Angeles in just before midnight.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 2: Lines. I remember seeing a map of typhoons inside the Philippines from @mapmakerdavid and wondering what a Caribbean version would look like, so here it is:
#30DayMapChallenge Day 4: Hexagons. Felt compelled to find some bee data. Wyoming has beehive registration data publicly available. Upper left is Yellowstone.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 5: Raster. Viking color mosaic with a little bumpification with MOLA relief. Data from NASA. Projection Equal Earth (Equal Mars?).
#30DayMapChallenge Day 6: Blue. I thought of the ocean and a world view of cyclones. So, here's a map I call Cyclones in Spilhaus

#30DayMapChallenge Day 7: Red. Redlands, California is named for its red soil. Downtown, there's a lovely vintage gas station mural that was recently restored. My map for the day is a digital recreation of it.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 9: Yellow. The sun - while its light is closer to white - false color images of extreme ultraviolet light (304 angstroms) help us understand more about it. Here's a 2012 NASA JPL measurement projected to Equal Earth (Equal Sol?) from the Sun 2015 spheroid.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 10: Black and White:  Roads of California. California has a reputation for car culture and traffic but there are also immense areas with little road infrastructure.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 11: Elevation: Hand drawing mountains with chalk and pencil. LOL, Nah, I re-purposed @nicolaraluk's excellent "Sketch the city" for mountains with Mount Hood and Matterhorn examples. See https://t.co/tjtEvXouuV

#30DayMapChallenge Day 12: Movement: Magnetic North has been moving at an accelerated rate in recent years causing update issues for those who rely on it. Here's an animation of unmarked declination contours moving over the last decade in North America.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 13: Tracks: Railroads in the Continental United States.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 14: Boundaries. Early maps of the Adirondack Park used blue ink for the park boundary. The boundary line became known as the Blue Line and the name is still used today.

It was a challenging day to find time to map, so this is a work in progress...

#30DayMapChallenge Day 15: Names. Many populated places in the United States are named after places in England, Scotland, and Wales - so I matched them up and generated connecting lines to see what would emerge...
#30DayMapChallenge Day 16: Places. London, but which London? Maybe New London? Certainly not the real London.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 17: Zones. Have you ever heard of the 100-mile border zone in the US? It's an area where US Customs and Border Patrol can perform searches for "reasonable suspicion" of immigration violations or crimes.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 18: Globe. Not a lot of time to map today, but I ~felt~ I should do something. Here's version of the moon-sized, deep-space mobile battle station constructed by the Galactic Empire.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 19: Urban. Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 20: Rural. Quick one today. What defines rural? For some it's just area that's not urban. So, how far from urban areas and clusters are portions of the US? (Yes, obvious border effects here, but not everyone can easily cross a border these days.)

#30DayMapChallenge Day 21: Environment. Morro Rock is one of the Nine Sisters - a chain of volcanic plugs between Morro Bay and San Luis Obispo. Rendered here in @ArcGISPro with LIDAR from PG&E, a black background, and clearly visible points for a pointillism effect.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 22: Built Environment. Buildings of Buffalo. This ends up being the opposite of the street grid but since they a related you see similar patterns. Note, as with the street names I also included Fort Erie, Ontario for a point of reference.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 23: Population. 2020 population density estimate for the world.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 24: Statistics. Bivariate comparison of home value and income for the United States.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 25: Climate. Probability of a White Christmas in the Continental US...in felt. A generalized remake of the original NOAA map with felt symbols. Original map here: https://t.co/AnyiiPHAe0

#30DayMapChallenge Day 26: Hydrology. Letchworth State Park and the Genesee River. Audaciously nicknamed "The Grand Canyon of the East," its beautiful deep gorge and waterfalls make it a favorite state park.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 27: Resources. Tahualtapa aka Mount Slover has been reduced to a small hill due to mining. I traced 1896 contours to recreate the mountain in 3D to get some perspective on its original stature.
#30DayMapChallenge Day 28: ü§£ You can make a map of Kansas with a small tear to the corner of an 11x17 sheet of paper. Happy Thanksgiving ü¶É

#30DayMapChallenge Day 29: Experimental. My daughter has a few "extreme connect the dots" books and I thought I'd try to make one of my own. Grab a pencil and print it at A0. PDF here: https://t.co/ONWkZzZPg9

#30DayMapChallenge Day 30: Home: A family project. @jenniferaadams's great-grandparents homesteaded in Nebraska and her great-aunt wrote a book about it. I mapped the homestead location on top of modern NAIP imagery.

Abstracting aerial imagery. Hillshading color values and blending back to the original image. Red: grassland areas, Tan: forested regions, Grays: rock, sand and urban spaces. #30DayMapChallenge Day 5: Raster. Made with love, @qgis and @OSGeo

Heart of the North Island. I always felt rivers resembled our own circulatory systems.  Lake Taupo made the perfect heart. Rivers from MfE. Lakes and hillshade from @LINZLDS. Made with @qgis, @OSGeo.   #30DayMapChallenge Day 7: Red

Gravity is not a constant.  Use of hillshade, slope, gradient to represent gravity as an elevation. Darker regions are lowest values. Interpolation with #SAGAGIS. Hillshade and slope with #GDAL. Visual blended with @qgis. Data from @LINZLDS . #30DayMapChallenge Day 11: Elevation
Day 17: Zones. Creating a slope between differences in aerial imagery color values suggesting homogeneous regions. Data @LINZLDS. Made with love, @qgis and gdal.  #30DayMapChallenge

#30DayMapChallenge Day 19: Urban. Point cloud visualization of the Sky Tower. This is an old image from about four years ago, but it never made it far from my hard drive.  I thought the urban theme would give it a good use and let it out to a wider audience.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 20: Rural.  Remnants of an oxbow river  overtaken by farms in the Wairarapa.  Wellington DSM blended with aerial imagery.  It took a lot of fiddling to get the river to stand out in this image. Data @LINZLDS. Made with @QGIS and other @OSGeo tools.

#30DayMapChallenge Day 22: Built Environment. One last recycled project... Wellington City.  Wellington DSM, DEM and aerial imagery.  Notice the scars from the roads cut into the sides of the steep hills. Data @LINZLDS. Bathy interpolation with SAGA GIS. Vis with @QGIS and @OSGeo

My only contributions to #30DayMapChallenge are for Day 23: Population. 4 Visualizations about the historical population of France from 1876 to 2015. Data from @InseeFr and @IGNFrance with @ArcGISJSAPI #esrijs 1/5
